Title: New SC Organization Promotes Benefits of Medical Cannabis
Content:
Poll by Push Digital and WPA Intel shows majority of SC voters support medical cannabis 

There is a new organization in South Carolina promoting the benefits of legalized access to medical cannabis. The South Carolina Cannabis Association is a recently announced Grassroots coalition of Palmetto State compassionate care advocates, farmers and businesses owners advocating for access to medical marijuana for those who need it.

Wesley Donehue, South Carolina political consultant and entrepreneur, played a key role in organizing the critical mass of support that led to the formation the South Carolina Cannabis Association. Donehue said, “The compassionate care benefits of cannabis are well documented and the public support for access to medical cannabis in our state is strong. These are facts our elected officials must come to recognize and respond accordingly, as there is no longer any excuse for them to be this out-of-touch with the will of their constituents.” 

The South Carolina Cannabis Association in conjunction with Push Digital and WPA Intelligence conducted a poll last week that clearly shows widespread support for medical cannabis. The professionally conducted, independent survey of 600 registered voters in South Carolina from January 22-24 found that:

Most South Carolina voters are in favor of medical cannabis

  • Six out of ten South Carolina voters (58%) support legislation that expands access to medical cannabis
  • This includes a majority or plurality support across all partisan breaks – Majority of Independents (72%), Democrats (65%) and a plurality of Republicans (45%)
  • In contrast, just thirteen percent (13%) are opposed while three out of ten (29%) are unsure

South Carolinians are more likely to vote for Elected Officials who support medical cannabis legislation 

  • A majority of South Carolinians (57%) are more likely to vote for an elected official who supports legislation for medical cannabis 
  • This too includes a majority or plurality support across all partisan breaks – majority of Independents (70%), Democrats (62%) and a plurality of Republicans (42%) are more likely to vote for an elected official who supports medical cannabis
  • Just thirteen percent (13%) are less likely to support an elected official who supports legislation that expands access for medical cannabis

Donehue continued, “Just a few short years ago, our state’s laws made it nearly impossible to operate a craft brewery in South Carolina. Through a combination of online organization and direct advocacy we convinced lawmakers the benefits of changing those laws and we successfully allowed for the establishment and expansion of this new, positive industry. That is exactly what the South Carolina Cannabis Association plans to do for the compassionate care use of medical marijuana in our state.”

State lawmakers in the House and Senate have introduced legislation establishing access to medical cannabis - The Compassionate Care Act(H. 3660& S. 366). The Senate and House bills create a regulated system through the state’s Department of Health and Environmental Control (DHEC) that will allow doctors to recommend the medical use of cannabis to patients with conditions such as multiple sclerosis, Parkinson's disease, cancer and post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD).

The South Carolina Cannabis Association sets the foundation to protect and promote the use of medical cannabis for compassionate care applications, as well as advocate on behalf of business owners and agricultural opportunities for marijuana in South Carolina. The association’s primary focus will include:

ADVOCACY:

SCCA will serve as a resource to the South Carolina General Assembly to implement a sensible and fair regulatory framework in regards to medical marijuana for compassionate care applications.

ACCESS:

SCCA will advocate on behalf of South Carolinians who need access to medical marijuana to enjoy the same quality of life that we all expect.

AGRICULTURE:

SCCA will promote South Carolina’s agricultural system and farmers by increasing the number, type and yield of crop options available to South Carolina’s farmers.

Click the link the find out more about this new organization, South Carolina Cannabis Association

Title: You Never Forget Your First Time
Content:
I had been working in politics for a while, but I decided to start a digital agency after the first time I went viral. 

This was back in 2009, President Barack Obama was giving a speech about his healthcare plan to a joint session of Congress, and our very own South Carolina Congressman Joe Wilson captured the nation’s attention. Breaking decorum, Wilson shouted “You lie!” when President Obama discussed the coverage of undocumented immigrants in his plan. It was unreal. The entire country was taken aback, especially those of us who know Joe as one of the most honorable and kind gentlemen you will ever meet.

Look, good or bad, right or wrong, it was a moment. And I found myself back at a bar on Folly Beach, SC all night. We were vacationing at the beach at a house with no wifi. The bar was the only place I could find. I was hyped on everything I had been experimenting with on our social and email channels, and I saw potential that (at that point in time) no one else did. 

I blasted out an email that night. I called my friend David All to start activating bloggers. My team spent the entire night keeping the site up because it was being hacked every minute. By the next day we were breaking fundraising records. In the 48 hours following the “You lie!” moment, we spun up, executed, and capitalized on a multi-channel, multi-platform campaign. The results were staggering. Millions of dollars raised with nearly 500,000 email signups.  

That was my first time going viral. Since then, I founded Push Digital, grew it into a full-service agency, and now lead my staff of nearly 50 in our daily work of earning real results for our customers by leveraging our digital expertise. Sometimes it’s a grind. Sometimes it’s a viral success. But pushing our clients to the next level, those are the moments we strive for. 

We’re ready to do it for you. If you’ve been curious about making gains, for your personal brand, your start up, or your organization, I’m inviting you to hit us up. This just might be your moment to go viral.

Title: You Can't Match My Hustle
Content:
I feel like a political candidate responding to an opponent. It’s weird that I normally suggest my clients do these type of responses and I’m having to do it myself. But, I guess business is a lot like political campaigns.

So, I’ve been traveling a lot lately trying to slam in all my travel before baby boy number three arrives here shortly. And as I’m out on the road pitching to clients, I’m hearing for the first time that some of my competitors out there that are pitching business against me are saying that, “Wesley no longer pays attention to PUSH - all he does is train for events and drink craft beer.”

Damn…that’s a ridiculous statement.

Look, I’m productive. I get up at 3:45 in the morning and I’m out the door by 4:30 AM. I’m done with my training before most of my competitors wake up in the morning. I don’t drink a lot of craft beer because of my training. And, I spend maybe 5-10% max of my time on Frothy Beard related activities - it’s connected to the office so, I’m able to just swing over and handle things whenever I want.

But, what drives me the craziest is that - I’m out there hustling. It’s 7 o’clock in the morning and I’m at the office.

I am up working out for two, sometimes three hours and at the office before my competitors even wake up in the morning.

I’m sorry that you guys (my competitors) are lazy as hell and can’t keep up with my work ethic and hustle.

But, while you’re binge watching Netflix at night, I’m in the bed by 8:00 PM, awake at 3:45 AM the next morning, getting my shit done and at the office before you fools even have your first cup of coffee.

There are a lot of things that I’m willing to take when people talk poorly of me. This is not one of them.

I spend probably 50-60 hours a week on Push Digital, growing this company, bringing in new clients, just hustling so I can keep paying people because livelihoods depend on what I do.

So, if you’re watching this and you’re one of my competitors, look - we can compete all day on work and I can disagree with you. I think our agency’s better, our creative is better. But, one thing you’re never going to beat me on is hustle.

And, if you want to try then bring it.

I will outwork you any day of the week.

That’s how I’m able to build my company, complete Ironman, be a good husband, be a good father AND start other companies all at the same time.

You can’t outwork me. Don’t even try.

You can go and try to say these things in pitches, trying to make it your differentiator.

That’s fine. Because my differentiator is that I work harder than you and I always will.
Excerpt: You can’t outwork me. Don’t even try.

Title: SC Craft Beer Facing Lots of Opposition
Content:
The SC Senate Judiciary subcommittee hearing on our craft beer agenda hit some pretty big obstacles last week when half the paid lobbyist at the statehouse stood up against us. It really is a giant mess when our small businesses have to fight against such a well funded machine and their only talking point is "this violates the three tier system?"

I have to ask - so damn what!?! What is so fundamental to our nation and state about the three tier system? I'm not even trying to tear down their precious little stranglehold on small business but at this point I just have to ask why the hell that one talking point even matters. And to be perfectly clear - only like 3 SC breweries I've ever talked to even wants to distribute their own beer. We like working with our distributors. We have our hands full doing what we do. The last thing we want to do is take responsibility for distributing our own beer. But so what? What if we did want to distribute our own beer? No one has given us any good reason except "it violates the three tier system." GIVE ME REAL REASONS INSTEAD OF AN 86 YEAR OLD TALKING POINTS!

Let's be clear about what's happening. The wholesalers in America are desperately holding onto an antiquated system built in 1933 and it has absolutely nothing to do with craft breweries. Frankly, they don't give a shit about us. Here's what they care about...

  1. In their eyes letting craft breweries have anything at all opens up the door for the big beer companies (MillerCoors AB InBev) to get the same. Because that's well over 90% of their income, they are using craft breweries as a wall that the big guys cannot cross.
  2. Because the super majority of their income comes from the big beer companies, they do what those companies say and in this case it's making sure that craft breweries do not get a fair shake at competition.

Straight up - I know it, you know it and legislators know it - this is absolutely anti-free market. There is no reason to keep the three tier system in place except to allow one industry to control another. But we will keep playing this game and pretending that the three tier system is vital to the bedrock of Democracy. You know, it's in the Bill of Rights... Life, Liberty and the Pursuit of Absolutely Control and Greed.

Just a couple decades ago before the transparency of the Internet and 24 hour cable news networks, rumor is that wholesalers kept their power through physical strength. Literally, they had hulked up drivers in communities threatening store owners, bartenders and even legislators. Or so I've been told by a couple Senators. They can't do that today so instead they control by throwing their money around. It's sickening, but that's the reality we live in.

God Bless America and Long Live The Three Tier System.

Anyway, here's a video update...
Excerpt: Here is everything you want to know about the current craft beer fight in the South Carolina legislature.

Title: Enjoy Life and Stay Healthy With Moderation
Content:
I’ve been on a role pumping out new content every week but honestly, this week got crazy. I’ve been traveling my face off to make up for the time I stayed home awaiting the arrival of our third son, Henry Lawton. So instead of giving you some new content we’ve created here at Push Digital I wanted to share this quick interview I did yesterday with a local Charleston TV station.

Click here to view the full interview.

So, how can I drink beer, eat pizza and run marathons? Stay focused. Eat healthy 95% of the time. Workout every single day. Cheat one day a week with beer and pizza!

I’m super excited that I was asked to be one of the Fitness Champions for the Trident United Way. It’s my job over the next month to share my story and help push people to concentrate on nutrition and fitness. Click here to learn more about my story.

If you live in the Charleston tri-county area, click here to take the four point pledge:

  1. I pledge to participate in improving the health and well-being of myself, my family and my community by taking action and by taking care.
  2. I pledge to educate myself and others, using safe and reputable resources, on any health topics prior to making lifestyle changes or long-term healthcare decisions.
  3. I pledge to familiarize myself with local resources and services available in my community.
  4. I pledge to hold myself accountable for my own health outcomes.

Click here to take the pledge.

Then share your fitness journey on social media using the hashtag #findyourfithtc
Excerpt: Take the pledge.

Title: Letting Frothy Beard Be Frothy Beard
Content:
How cool is it that Push Digital is connected to Frothy Beard Brewing Company?  We don’t just mean physically. Our businesses are connected through our partners. Our cultures are connected. Our marketing is certainly connected.

We don’t know how many breweries have a 40 person marketing team literally inside their walls, but outside of the big boys like MillerCoors and ABinbev were going to guess that the answer is ZERO.

Our goal for Frothy Beard marketing is pretty simple - let Frothy be Frothy. Just highlight who they (or we) are - comic book, sci-fi, fantasy and video game fans. All those things that stopped us from being one of the cool kids while growing up, but now it’s what’s dominating pop culture. The Frothy partners are geeks. They’re weird. So we’re just highlighting exactly that. Get weird!

Check out some of the fun videos we’ve knocked out for Frothy Beard.

Every Christmas The Grinch shows back up:

Finding love over beer:

Speaking of finding love and getting a little weird:

Who ya gonna call?

Run when you see a red balloon:

Sip, sip and then pass:

And just remember to always stay hydrated:

As you can see, these aren’t expensive high quality videos, but they work. Frothy has exploded because of it’s marketing. And all we did was simply let them be who they are.
Excerpt: Our goal is simple.

Title: We Make Senators
Content:
How does a little firm from [way] outside the beltway with a brewery and a team full of quirky millennials consistently add big names to the most powerful governing body on the planet?

Simple. We know campaigns and we know digital.

Push Digital sits outside the DC social bubble, in Charleston, South Carolina. We’re not a “superfirm” stacked with heavyweight consultants who have the ability to throw our muscle around. We don’t have powerful friends or relatives who sit in positions of influence. Shit, we rarely even showcase our political work out of deference to not hog our clients’ limelight. 

But we still elect Senators. Cycle in. Cycle out.

Why are we so successful? We operate in the “Goldilocks zone” of digital. We’re old enough to have real-world campaign experience, but young enough to have the hustle, the drive and the proven digital expertise to deliver at the highest level.

Let me break this down:

“America is all about speed. Hot, nasty, badass speed.” - Will Ferrell

This past April, we launched Tommy Tuberville’s bid for Alabama Senate. Not only will Tommy win, he is going to be a star in the upper chamber. Coach Tommy’s team called us at 4pm on a Friday and needed to launch a U.S. Senate campaign the following Monday. Here’s how the “Goldilocks zone” comes into play: The Push Digital team was experienced enough to understand the magnitude of the undertaking and know every element that needed to be completed, and we were young and energetic enough to damn the torpedoes, work through the weekend and get it done fast! Our partners and clients can always rely on us to get things done with diligence and precision.

Burnt Fingers, Ask For Tongs

Every campaign is different, but you see enough of them and muscle memory kicks into gear.  Again, we’re in the “Goldilocks zone” with institutional knowledge of how big, competitive races need to be executed. We’re a team who’s managed (literally) hundreds of digital campaigns and has refined the process. The procedural integrity of this team is tight because we’ve done it over and over again. We’ve seen what has worked, what has failed and learned lessons along the way. I promise your 50+ year-old TV media guy who “does digital” has no idea why we used a particular emoji in social copy and doesn’t keep an archive of UTM codes. Every move is strategically made because we’re constantly revising our methods and adding to the algorithm that is Push Digital.

Talent Wins Games. Teamwork Wins Championships.

I don’t want the title of this article to give you the wrong impression. We work to elect U.S. Senators as part of a team of very talented, very specialized consultants. But one of the reasons we’ve been able to be a part of these incredible races is our commitment to being team players and offering the very best of our talents to the whole group. It’s always my goal for everyone on the campaign—staff and consultants included—to walk into Election Day knowing “Push Digital hustled their ass off and delivered for me.”
Excerpt: We know campaigns and we know digital.
Image Title: Push Tuberville image-02|190501_Tuberville Launch Blog_Official Headshots-01

Title: Fighting For Those That Fight For Us
Content:
I’ll never forget the first time Stop Soldier Suicide came into the Push Digital office in the Summer of 2018. Initial onboarding meetings with clients typically go the same. But this meeting was different. In this meeting we listened. We listened and we learned. We listened to Stop Soldier Suicide’s co-founder and former Army Ranger tell us about all those close to him that have taken their own lives. We learned that 20 service members and veterans a day take their own life.

20.

Every single day.

That’s a lost soldier, airman, marine, or a veteran - every 72 minutes.

I remember thinking at that moment - “I want Push Digital to take on this project, and I want to lead it.”

This was unlike any other project Push Digital had worked on before. Navigating a topic as sensitive as soldier and veteran suicide is no easy task, but remembering the impact that Stop Soldier Suicide is having on the lives of our service members and their families, and our veterans makes it worth it.

Since beginning our partnership in July of 2018, we have been able to help Stop Soldier Suicide achieve goals that have surprised even us - month after month.

What Stop Soldier Suicide Does: As the nation’s first veteran-founded-and-led 501(c)3 nonprofit, Stop Soldier Suicide helps active duty members, veterans, and their fmailies navigate the maze of the thousands of resources available to them.

Their Mission/Goals: To see a day where veterans and active duty service members are at no greater risk of suicide than their peers who have not served. Their digital goals were to increase brand awareness and build a community of supporters to aid their mission.

Push’s Strategy: Create engaging and emotional digital content that would help build Stop Soldier Suicide’s audience and get the word out about the work Stop Soldier Suicide is doing.

Check out some of the awesome video projects we’ve pulled off for Stop Soldier Suicide. If they don’t spark some sort of motivation to help or desire to get involved, you’re simply not human.

Interested in learning more about Stop Soldier Suicide? Click here.

Credit: Lindsay DeTroia, Senior Account Executive at Push Digital
Excerpt: Unlike any project we've ever done.

Title: One Tip For Authentic Campaign Videos
Content:
The typical campaign launch video formula is a candidate speaking directly to the camera cut with some b-roll of the candidate shaking hands and kissing babies. We've all seen it...

In Tina’s video, we knew it was important to use her social media videos to help showcase the depth and excitement of her candidacy. Using the candidate’s self-shot home videos adds an extra layer of authenticity and context to the story you’re trying to tell.

This past month, we launched the digital campaign of Tina Ramirez in Virginia’s 7th Congressional District. Tina is a dynamic candidate with a powerful story. She’s a single mom, an educator, and has traveled the world fighting for religious freedom through her non-profit organization.

Think about it — if everyone is using mobile videos to tell their own story on social media, wouldn’t integrating that medium be helpful when telling the story of a candidate?

Mobile videos take no time to make. Likewise, every candidate between the ages of 18 and 45 years old has a couple of good ones laying around.

Posed, set up b-roll is important. But, in a new era of digital communication, don’t count out mobile video.

P.S. Check out Tina's awesome website.
Excerpt: Selfies are in.

Title: The Importance of Conceptual Thinking
Content:
In the creative realm, there is a clear difference between superficial, decorative work and conceptual work. But when you try to examine the differences between the two, it can be tough to find a guide on the subject. Here’s one perspective:

A charcoal drawing or oil painting of household objects – oranges, a flower vase, some gloves, a bird’s feather from the yard – is a still life. And there’s nothing wrong with that. But it’s decoration. It isn’t saying to the viewer anything other than “look at these subtle variances of light and shadow.” It isn’t doing anything besides conveying a representation of an inanimate thing.

But take that same style of artwork – charcoal drawing, oil painting, whatever – and select a different set of objects. Instead of fruit and a burlap sack, try depicting the warm glow of a Jedi’s lightsaber on top of some spare droid parts and a folded robe. Instead of ordinary flowers spilling out of a porcelain vase, try representing the flowers as two-dimensional, digital pixels. If you maintain enough similarities with the original mode of execution (in this case, the aesthetic of a traditional still life), you’ll change just enough of the outcome to create a visual statement.

One relatively easy way to conceptualize in a creative way is by combining mundane elements that wouldn’t ordinarily go together. For instance, there’s nothing particularly remarkable about a formal suit you’d wear to a wedding, or camouflage attire you’d put on before going out into the woods to hunt in – but combine the two things, and you have a camouflage dress suit. A ‘fashion statement,’ which is just another phrase for creative – or conceptual - clothing.

In the creative realm, there is a clear difference between superficial, decorative work and conceptual work.

In marketing, concept is hugely important. It’s one of the main reasons why memes are so effective as a social awareness tool for marketing campaigns. Juxtaposing topical elements in a contradictory way that’s instantly recognizable without explanation is almost unparalleled in terms of effectiveness and the potential for something to go viral. If the concept is strong enough, the aesthetics or technical impressiveness of a given image, or video, or bit of writing, are rendered all but irrelevant. Memes don’t need to look good in order to work.

At Push Digital, our designers value the importance of concept across all areas of advocacy, brands, political, and strategic communications. Among many other things, we are visual problem solvers. We ensure that no campaign – no matter how large or small – begins without a goal in mind and a clear way to get there.

Let’s brainstorm together.

Credit: John Philips, Art Director at Push Digital
Excerpt: We are visual problem solvers.

Title: 8 Things The Corporate World Can Learn From Political Campaigns
Content:
I recently gave a talk at a big human resources event in Charleston, DisruptHR (check it out). I give a lot of talks but this one was super unique because it followed the Pecha Kucha style format.

I only had five minutes to speak and I was required to have twenty slides which progressed automatically every fifteen seconds. That means I had to memorize twenty fifteen second snippets.

Perhaps you can take a lesson or two and apply it to your business.

Think of your absolute worst HR nightmares.. That pretty much sums up how a political campaign operates. The best two words to describe the campaign workplace is unprofessional and hostile. Most normal people wouldn’t last two days on a political campaign.

I’ve been in a fist fight in a campaign office. I’ve been passed out drunk in a closet. I’ve walked in on people screwing - twice.

You’re targeting a lot of specific demographics so things are said that many would take as sexist, racist or at a minimum stereotyping.

You’re constantly being degraded, cursed at and made to feel like a genuine piece of shit  - like you can’t do anything right.

You cry. You yell. You curse a lot.

You work every night, every weekend, and every holiday with very little pay and absolutely no benefits.

But when it’s over and you look back at those moments - you’re grateful. Because you know that you can handle anything - any person, any crisis, any drama, any bullshit. You know how to get shit done. You know how to tackle any problem that comes your way

Moving from the campaign world into corporate marketing to work with small, medium and even huge corporations was a complete shock to my system. I quickly learned that you can’t just tell people to go fuck themselves, to stay at the office all night or to come in on Saturday to get their shit done.

More disturbing than either of those realizations was learning that you can’t just push the ball forward because someone might get their feelings hurt. You may step on someone’s toes. The chain of command is way too long. Decisions can take weeks instead of immediately like I was used too.

Everyday you have to jump through 100 hoops just to post something to Twitter. Leaders are afraid of innovation because they have a cozy position, good pay, maybe some stock options. Change could hurt them personally. Oh, and lawyers. So many damn lawyers.

SeaWorld was under attack by PETA and their attendance and their stock price plummeted. We were brought in to help stop the bleeding. Day one on the job, I stepped in and asked how long it would take to send out an email to their customer list. They said 45 days.

It took them one year from the premiere of the damaging Blackfish documentary until they responded to the animal abuse allegations. ONE FULL YEAR. Because people who don’t know shit about PR refused to let them. And their inaction nearly put them out of business.

SeaWorld isn’t alone. I could rattle off names like Sears, K-Mart and many others we’ve worked with stuck in the same bullshit. No campaign would ever operate this way. The whole corporate system is set up to hear too many opinions, to stop progress, to protect the status quo and to kill innovation.

You don’t have to have sex in offices, curse people out or drink yourself into oblivion to get things done like on a political campaign. You don’t have to have the HR nightmares. You can have it both ways. Here are a few things corporate America should take from political campaigns to get more shit done.

1. Campaigns work well because everyone is rallied behind a single common goal - to win the election.

Not knowing where you’re going creates an environment where people drag their feet. Every business should have one large goal beyond just ‘make money’ to help rally the troops.

2. That big goal is broken down into mini-sprints where everyone works furiously toward the same goal.

In campaigns it’s all about the financial quarter where the media reports on our strength. Find those short term goals and then celebrate the completion of those goals throughout the year.

3. Campaigns have a defined enemy.

It’s our common goal to destroy that enemy. It gets everyone on the same page. It rallies the team. It boosts morale. Find a target to go after and rally the team around catching that enemy, growing past that enemy and perhaps even shutting that enemy down.

4. Campaigns have a simple hierarchy

A consolidated senior team, very little middle management, and as many worker bees as they can find. Decisions are passed up the chain quickly, approved and immediately implemented.

With that said, titles are bullshit.

5. Whoever can do the job and steps up is the right person for the job.

And no one on a campaign would ever fault anyone for stepping up to get a job done. People get the job done or they get out of the way.

6. Campaigns do not allow destructive people in their ranks.

We surround ourselves with loyal teammates and would never get in the bunker with someone who would drop the grenade. We fire very quickly.

Businesses on the other hand let people just linger and soak up precious resources. Take the feelings out of the equation and cut people.

7. Campaigns don’t let lawyers get involved in messaging. Ever!

Lawyers are there to answer one question - will this get me in trouble?  They stay in their lane. Don’t let lawyers scare you into inaction. Don’t let them bully their way into your meeting.

8. Let numbers make the decision for you.

Egos in business can often get in the way of good decision making and everyone wants to prove their worth by giving their opinion. On the campaign trail - you follow the poll because that's your path to victory. The data is the final arbiter of what a good idea or bad idea is or isn’t.

So while political campaigns may be the nightmare of every HR professional, their ability to get shit done is something every corporation should emulate and scale.

I have done so at my agency and yes, these changes bread hostility in the workplace, but you can negate that on the front end if you know what you’re walking into.

Have a great night full of positive vibes.

Title: 11 Do's & Don'ts of Crisis Communication
Content:
Whether you’re in business or politics, crises are inevitable. That’s just a fact.

Accidents and terrible situations are going to occur, but how you handle those situations could not be more crucial. So, what do you do if you ﬁnd yourself in a crisis? Respond quickly, eﬀectively, eﬃciently and in a sincere manner.

Or you can follow the Push Digital 3 Step System:
1. Tell it all.

2. Tell it fast.

3. Tell the truth.

Believe it or not, following those 3 simple steps is more diﬃcult than you would think. However, thanks to our work with larger corporations and our combined 50+ years of campaign experience, we’ve compiled a comprehensive list of dos and please-whatever-you-do-don’t-do-thats.

So here they are…

1. DO get all the facts.
If you ﬁnd yourself in a crisis, before you can even think about controlling the narrative, you have to gather ALL of the facts. Step one is talking to every single person involved. Literally everyone. Step two is all about keeping calm. Remember that there are multiple sides to every story, so try not to jump to conclusions. Step three is expect the unexpected. Work with the facts and not your feelings.

2. DO own it and apologize.
Time is crucial, so respond quickly and admit the mistake. Then proceed to apologize, again and again....and again. Be sincere and simple in apologizing, even if the absolute truth is more complicated and blame isn't necessarily singular.

3. DO the right thing.
Even if you’re one single person or a corporation with millions of employees, morals can get messy and, for that, we have just one piece of advice: Do the right thing. Period. Then make sure your audience knows how you plan to ﬁx it and the timeline for completing. Being open and transparent in this situation could not be more important. Don’t fake it till you make it because the internet trolls will know.

4. DON'T dwell on the mistake.
We all know the mistake happened, you owned up to it, and hopefully by now you’ve ﬁxed it. In politics OR business, you should recognize every crisis as an opportunity, and pivot to a positive note while you’ve still got everyone’s attention. Eventually, the media and press will die down and when it does you’ve already discovered a new path to victory and your team is cruising through the punch list.

5. DO rebuild your brand.
The media and the trolls have knocked you down… and now it’s time to get back up. Rebuild the brand by looking for opportunities to prove you've corrected the crisis and reinforce your brand principles. Reward customer loyalty and give new customers a reason to do business.

6. DO know the battlefield.
In today’s world… the Internet is and will always be the battleﬁeld. Every single day until forever… things don’t just go away.
1. Post Wisely - Keep your digital footprint in check.
2. Know Your Opponent - Learn from their mistakes so you don’t have to.
3. Be Relevant - Make time for making yourself and your business better.

7. DO know your opponent.
In politics, your opponent could be the very reason you’re running for public ofﬁce. But in business, it could be your competitor, the janitor or a radical activist. Sometimes the real enemy isn’t clear to you or to the public. So, make sure you know who you are ﬁghting. Deﬁne them. Understand them. Set the agenda. Expose them. Learn from them.

8. DO talk to an attorney. DON'T let them keep you from responding.
Attorneys are important to keep you out of jail… but they can also gum up the system and make it impossible for you to respond quick enough. Attorneys are risk averse. By nature, they are. “Should we take a risk, or should we NOT take a risk?” “Not.” What you are really looking for is an evaluation of the risk, not a total avoidance of it. Because, ultimately, you will have to make the call if you are in charge.

9. DON’T feed the trolls. DO feed the beast.
You won’t make Internet trolls happy no matter how many questions you answer.
1. Humor The Trolls - Comedic relief is brilliant but be careful because humor is not universal.
2. Counter-Fact The Trolls - Engage the trolls with the cold, hard facts and address the crisis head-on.
3. Don’t Join The Trolls - Don’t stoop to their level. Very rarely does corporate trolling pan out as originally intended.
4. But Do Feed The Beast - During a crisis, content is key, so be prepared and have quality items ready to go.

10. DO measure.
How often should you poll? Let us ask you this: how often are vital signs taken during a medical emergency? Constantly. That may be more often than is practical or affordable for your company, but the short answer is: measure public sentiment as often as you can. Then poll again. And again. Make an adjustment. And poll again.

11. DON'T wait until a crisis to have a crisis team in place.
There are many tips to get you through a crisis, but every single of of them relies on a solid team who is ready to mobilize the second a crisis hits, because you aren’t going to have time once the shit hits the fan. Don’t put too many cooks in the kitchen. The team must be small enough to move quickly and efﬁciently. Remember, Nick Fury assembled The Avengers before the aliens attacked New York.

That’s it! I mean, well… there’s a whole lot more to it when we dive into the specifics of each individual crisis but for the most part, things tend to fall under those 11 big rules. We’re going to dive even further into each rule here on this channel soon. Thanks for listening.
Excerpt: Crises are inevitable.
Image Title: 190605_Push - Wes - Static Image - 11 Dos & Donts of Crisis Communications Blog Header_964x482

Title: Digital Has Changed Who We Are As A Species
Content:
Most of us think of technology and the Internet as a tool used to reach people for marketing purposes. We tend to think of it as something very similar to TV, radio, mail, and billboards. It is however something very very different.

Here at Push Digital we argue that while it can and is used as a tool for marketing it has become much more than just that. In fact it has become the next step in human evolution. Until you understand how it has changed us as a species you will not be able to use it effectively in your marketing.

In a recent podcast interview Elon Musk was asked at what point do humans become cyborgs. Musk responded that we are already cyborgs and we don't even realize it. We are cyborgs because we have these devices connected to us at all times but they're not our pockets they're in our hands. The only thing that will change in the future is the speed at which that data gets from the device to your brain.

We are heading in that direction and there's no turning back.

You already know that digital is changing a lot of industries around the world including the transportation industry, the hotel industry, and the entertainment industry. Donald Trump was elected president because of the internet and every day he is disrupting the media industry with his Twitter account. He's bypassing the media and going straight to us.

Digital is also changing the way laws are made. In 2016 Push Digital ran a digital campaign targeted at the South Carolina Statehouse which aided in a 600 million dollar gas tax increase to fix the state's crumbling roads.

It's not just industries, the Internet is changing us. Most obviously it is changing the way we socialize. Social media has 100% of our attention, and that isn't changing any time soon.

So why is all this happening and what does it mean for you? It's happening because that thing in your hand is your one stop shop for everything - your phone, camera, alarm clock, calculator, compass, and so much more. Most importantly your ability to access all the content ever created in the history of the world and the ability to connect with anyone around the world at a moment's notice.

And what that means is that we know every single thing about you. All the scary stories you hear about privacy ... Pretty true. Your privacy is gone. There is no going back. You accepted that the moment you put all these devices in your pocket. Complaining about it is like standing butt naked in front of a window and being angry that everyone can see you.

While this might be scary for you as an individual, it's very good for marketers.

We no longer have to throw a campaign out there and see what sticks. Now we can target you with content youcare about. This is what we do at Push Digital.

Now, in the future this won't be limited to just your phone. Connected TV is next - stay tuned.
Excerpt: There's no turning back.

Title: Drop the Facade. Be You.
Content:
What you do is a reflection of who you are. Every action tells us something about you. Don’t be one of those people who show us some fake digital version of who you want to be. Be honest. Be transparent. Showing us your true self will make you want to live a true life. Then you actually become the person you’re pretending to be. Mondays are a day for a hard reset as you’re coming off the weekend showing us that fake digital life. 

As for me, the real honest me is a man hustling as hard as I can to be better than the person I was when I woke up yesterday.

Wishing you nothing but Positive Vibes on this beautiful Monday morning. 

#positivevibes

Title: Choosing to Fight... Another Day
Content:
Take a smaller step today. Last night I deactivated my Twitter account for awhile. I’ll jump back on later but yesterday I just decided that I didn’t need that constant barrage of fighting, drama and negativity. It was just a bunch of people saying things to each other that they would never say to a person’s face. I felt so much anger building up in my heart, so I said “enough is enough.” And by now, you all know me. I don’t shy away from a fight. I get sucked right in. That’s the key to failure. The best way to change my behavior is to eliminate the environment. No negativity. Positivity only because positivity fuels creativity, work ethic and success.

This seems like such a cliche statement. It’s so simple, right? In reality this is one of the hardest things to implement, especially when it involves removing people from your life. 

What can you do today to eliminate negativity so that you’re surrounded by positive people only?

I hope you have a Tuesday full of #positivevibes

Title: What Fuels Your Drive?
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes:

I understand that some of you will be offended by the language. I urge you to research David Goggins and pick up his book “Can’t Hurt Me.” It’s now one of my top five favorite books. Warning: it’s like crack to super motivated people.

Some people use their past as an excuse. Some people use their past as fuel. 

Which are you?

I made a decision decades ago to never forget my past. Instead I dwell on it. I remind myself every day of the horrible things I’ve seen. I vowed to never see them again. Then I vowed to be a successful person. Later I vowed to raise a family the complete opposite way.

Goggins is right. You can come from serious crap and become something completely different if you use the crap as fuel in your engine. As for me, I’m not the “baddest motherfucker on the planet” but I have done a few awesome things and I’m working on a whole lot more. I thank God that I came from the sewer. I wouldn’t have any of this had I not.

Wishing you seriously strong positive vibes on this Wednesday.

#positivevibes #entrepreneur #motivationalquotes

Title: Keep Calm. Ignore the Haters.
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes:

I made a mistake. Yesterday I reactivated my Twitter account to respond to a reporter’s tweet. I was immediately attacked by a Columbia politico who is absolutely one of the most vile humans I’ve ever met. There’s nothing positive about this lobbyist, his character or his actions. He is the embodiment of negativity.

Everything in me wanted to respond but I did not. I realized that I can not control this person’s actions. More devastating is that his personal attack threw me off track, disturbed my focus and stopped me from enjoying time with my family. He put me in a foul mood. Fortunately my mood is something I can control. I re-deactivated my Twitter account and instead decided to focus on what I can control - my own successes. 

I have a rule - if something doesn’t fall into one of these categories I don’t focus on it all:

1. Spending time with family
2. Building a relationship with God
3. Building wealth
4. Crossing finish lines
5. Finding peace

Those are things I can control. Things and people I cannot control are irrelevant. They only get in the way of success.

Focus on the positive. Ignore the negative.

Wishing you so many Positive Vibes today.

#positivevibes

Title: Can't Find Solutions? Dismiss your Vampires.
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes:

I strongly suggest that you read The Energy Bus by Jon Gordon.

Clemson fans - Gordon works with Clemson a lot and doesn’t shut up in his books about Dabo.

Gamecock fans - yes, you may want to vomit but I promise the book is still a must-read. And I hate to admit it, Dabo can teach us all something about positive leadership.

Anyway, last year I read his book and immediately hung this sign in our conference room. It’s a reminder that we won’t accept negative vibes in our meetings. No excuses. No whining. No complaints. We are meeting to find solutions to problems faced by our clients. Period. Negativity concentrates on problems. Positivity concentrates on solutions.

Vampires who suck the positivity out of our meetings will be dismissed. Vampires who suck the positivity out of our company will be dismissed permanently. Far too often we have let these vampires stay around the company and they became a cancer that spread to everyone else. I no longer let that happen, even if the employee is a stellar worker. Attitude matters.

I’ve taken that same stance on life. I eliminate those people from my circle completely. You know who I’m talking about. They always have drama. They’re always sick. Something in their life is always going wrong. All is dark.

Good friends try to help those people, but sometimes a vampire just cannot be turned. So you must drive a stake right through it’s heart. Okay, not really. You just cut them loose. Sometimes that in turn causes even more drama, but that drama is short-lived and the long term benefits are so numerous they cannot be counted. 

Wishing you so many Positive Vibes and for you to be surrounded by positive people!

#positivevibes

Title: "Love Thy Neighbor" - Matthew 22:39
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes:

Immigration, abortion, taxes, gay rights, guns. Things can get pretty hot here on social media. I’ve made it a rule in recent years to address every single issue by asking two questions:

1. How does the second greatest commandment impact my position on this issue?

2. How does the second greatest commandment impact how I talk to people about this issue?

We all know that I’ve fallen short of my own rule and that’s created quite the firestorm on a couple occasions. Some I’ve done to myself. Some have been attacks from others. People have taken my words out of context, they’ve cut out a sentence or two from a full statement to make me something I’m not and they’ve even lied about my comments. Still, I know who I am and I return to my rule even when I want to lash out at everyone.

Maybe you’re an atheist or you worship a different God. Even so, this one simple rule transcends all and should be applied across the board. Just think of how much negativity we could all remove from our lives if we simply follow the second greatest commandment.

I hope your Sunday is full of Positive Vibes! 

#positivevibes

Title: Waste Not, Want Not
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes:

It’s Monday morning. Hard reset!

Each of us have 10,080 minutes this week. How did you waste your minutes last week? How did each of those minutes add up to take time away from your top five priorities? What can you do different this week?

Last week I got into a few political fights on social media. Far less than normal but still enough time to harm a focus area. That won’t happen this week.

How about you? 

Have an amazing Monday full of Positive Vibes. 

#positivevibes

Title: Place Priorities Where You Can See Them
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes:

Yesterday I wrote that Mondays are a day to reset and to focus on your priorities. That begs the question - what are your priorities?

Mine are simple:

1. Be a good husband and father.
2. Get closer to God.
3. Grow my little business empire and concentrate on financial education.
4. Train for my next IRONMAN.
5. Relax daily and find mental clarity.

Without listing and reviewing my priorities I find that my day and my mind become completely cluttered with unimportant tasks that only get in the way of what’s most important. That creates unneeded stress and many negative vibes.

I keep my list posted to my closet wall and as the background in my iPhone so that I’m reminded all day everyday. It keeps me focused. And focus builds Positive Vibes.

Wishing the most Positive Vibes ever on your Tuesday.

#positivevibes

Title: Saying "NO" is a Discipline
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes:

Oh this one is so dang hard for me. No matter how hard I try to break it I have this habit of trying to make everyone happy. I want everyone to like me. So I overcommit, get super stressed and I fill my soul with negative vibes.

I decided to do 2019 different and to start saying “NO.” If something doesn’t fit into one of my main five priorities than my immediate reaction is to decline. 

There is one exception. At least once per week I try to go out of my way to help someone else. While that doesn’t on the surface look like it fits into one of my priorities, I think it’s what God would want and that strengthens my relationship with Him, which is a top priority.

Other than that, “NO” it is. That focuses me on priorities, that gives me more successes and those give me lots of Positive Vibes.

How can you eliminate clutter from your life by saying “no” today?

Wishing you so many Positive Vibes today.

#positivevibes
Image Caption: Wesley Donehue Saying No

Title: Talk More Than Speak
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes:

Empathy: the ability to understand and share the feelings of another.

What would happen if we spent some time listening to another person’s views rather than just yelling at everyone online? 

That’s been my goal for the last five years. Admittedly, it has been hard since my big abortion flap when, instead of folks listening to my view, I was silenced by the mob and even people within my own circle. 

While that has opened my eyes to the state of the internet and of this nation as a whole, I’m trying very hard to not let that deter me. Instead of running my mouth, I’m trying to not only listen, but to put myself in the speaker’s shoes. I may not agree, but I can at least see their point of view and that’s a great starting place for a real discuss rather than just an argument.

Now, of course no one really wants a discussion in this day and age. They want to fight, yell the loudest and claim victory. And of course that has created an atmosphere of extreme negative vibes and what I believe is the beginning of our nation’s downfall.

Still I am optimistic that this great nation can rebound. I believe it starts with listening more than talking. Maybe then we can spread more Positive Vibes.

I hope your Thursday is completely full of Positive Vibes.
Image Caption: Wesley Donehue Gasp

Title: What Are You Grateful For Today?
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes:

It’s 7:30 am and I’m just now waking up. My alarm went off like it does every morning at 3:45 am and I just turned that crap off. I’m finally starting to listen to my body. This week on the road has been a ball buster and I’m exhausted. All to say, today’s Positive Vibes will be short.

A few months back I started a daily routine of listing out ten things I’m grateful for. Some are big. Some are small. I’m always sure to be more specific than “my wife” or “my kids.” The whole purpose is to remind myself that life is pretty damn awesome. And that brings tons of Positive Vibes.

I ask you now - what are you grateful for today? You don’t have to give me ten. Give me one or two.

Here is my list from yesterday. 

1. The bacon at the DC Trump Hotel.
2. Running on the mall.
3. 66 degree weather. 
4. Everything bagels.
5. Having drinks with my very first mentor and getting really good advice.
6. My rainbow seersucker pants.
7. Spreading positive cheer for all to hear.
8. Super productive meetings in DC means I’m not wasting time.
9. Not being hung over is the best.
10. Just thinking about getting home to my family today makes me happy. 

Wishing you so many Positive Vibes as you head into your weekend.
Image Caption: Wesley Donehue Design
Tags: appreciation|grateful|positive thinking|positive vibes|positivity|what are you grateful for today

Title: Today Sucked! But It's A Good Thing
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes:

Today’s run SUCKED! I was totally riding the struggle bus. Every step was a mess.

How is that positive? Let me tell you...

If you pay attention to all these Instafools you will think success is so damn easy. Get six pack abs, run a marathon, start a business, work everyday from the beach. They’re all showboating and selling complete bullshit.

That’s why you don’t just see me posting pictures of finish lines or gloating about landing a big client. I share my struggles with you because you need to see what it really takes. It’s frigging hard. All of it. People need to see that because if they think it’s all easy and then they hit rough spots, they will give up thinking they just aren’t as good as those Instafools. It’s just not possible for them. And that’s not true.

The important thing to know is that the struggle is what it’s all about. Keeping pushing as hard as you can and you will start finding success and many POSITIVE VIBES!

Accept the negative to find the positive!

Wishing you all the positive vibes in the world today!
Image Caption: Wesley Donehue Blog
Tags: monday|positive thinking|positive vibes|positivity|today sucked but its a good thing

Title: What Can You Eliminate Today?
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes:

I’m coming to you late today. It’s been a crazy yet productive Monday. So I was thinking while on my run today that when we talk about positivity we so often think about what we can add to our lives. I need this or I want that. Today I encourage you to do the opposite and ask yourself - what can I eliminate today?

You probably know by now that the Donehue family is moving. Don’t worry... or celebrate if you’re some. We are only moving about two miles down the road. Elizabeth’s childhood home hit the market and it’s nicer and more suited for a family of our size. While packing we are taking the time to really purge. Yesterday I loaded up the truck multiple times for trips to the dump and to Goodwill. It felt so good to eliminate so much clutter and junk from my life.

Also this week I’m really focusing on eliminating alcohol from at least four days. I have at least two to three drinks every single night and it’s really impacting my training, which is ramping up starting today. Crossing finish lines brings me more joy than daily drinking and damn those beers taste so much better after a race.

I’ve found that eliminating crap from my life brings me many more Positive Vibes than adding. So today I ask - what can you eliminate from your life to bring you more positivity?

Wishing you all the Positive Vibes this new week has to offer!
Image Caption: Wesley Donehue good news
Tags: good vs. bad|positive|positive thinking|positive vibes|what can you eliminate today

Title: Let Your Voice Be Heard
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes:

The whole Frothy debacle a few months back did not happen because I said something crazy or “offensive.” It happened because we now live in a time when everyone wants to silence the opposition , especially public figures, with threats of embarrassment and boycotts. That doesn’t mean the debacle wasn’t my fault. It was. 

Truth be told, I’m a phenomenal public relations and campaign strategist - one of the best in South Carolina and in this country. Yet for some stupid reason I ignored the advice I give my clients. Now I give that advice to you because it’s one of the best things you can do to avoid negativity and to find so many more Positive Vibes in your day. 

Here it is - stop getting sucked into social media arguments.

I’m not saying to let the opposition scare you into silence. I’m saying that you should speak up on issues important to you. You should be yourself. 

However, our social feeds are full of hundreds of opportunities for fights every day and I see so many friends getting sucked in. Hell, that was me for a long time. I fixed that problem and then somehow I fell right back into it earlier this year. 

Facebook and especially Twitter give you all the opportunities you need to fight, make enemies, be put in a bad mood, ruin your day and sometimes even ruin your life. Why is making your point worth all that? Trust me, it’s not. Ignore the social BS, move on, smile at your success in not engaging and let your heart be full of Positive Vibes.

Oh, and let your voice be heard, debate with your polite friends and ignore the those who can’t debate without being a jerk. Stand up for your beliefs. You can do that without engaging in every fight.

I hope your Tuesday is the best Tuesday ever and full of nothing but Positive Vibes!

#positivevibes
Image Caption: Wesley Donehue talking
Tags: debate|let your voice be heard|positive|positive thinking|positive vibes|Tuesday

Title: What Often Stands In The Way Becomes the Way
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes:

"Our actions may be impeded but there can be no impeding our intentions or dispositions. Because we can accommodate and adapt. The mind adapts and converts to its own purposes the obstacle to our acting. The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way."

- Marcus Aurelius

Some folks use their hardships as an excuse to fail in everything, even in life. Others use their struggles as the fuel behind their successes. Roman Emperor and Stoic philosopher Marcus Aurelius wrote these words over 1,800 years ago understanding that the crappiest parts of our lives are also the most important. What you think is the impediment to your success is actually what will lead to your success. That wall you have to climb will teach you how to climb walls and make you stronger for when another wall appears. And yes, a lot more walls will appear on your path.

Personally, I deal with drama and stress far better than most humans I know. It’s my super power. I was brought up in a home full of both physical and emotional violence. I experienced things no child should ever experience. At the time I cried, I hid under beds with my sister and I begged for it all to end. What I didn’t realize is that it calloused my mind. It built a suit of armor around my thoughts. It gave me all the tools I need to do everything I’m doing right now. I would not be the man I am today without the violent childhood. Truly, what stood in the way became the way.

Negativity fills our lives, especially as social media fuels more divisiveness in our nation. It may seem at first glance that the negativity is our downfall, but I believe it is simply the “obstacle to our acting.” The negativity is exactly what we need to become more positive people because we will learn how to ignore it, smile and spread positivity both internally and externally.

So today when you feel the negativity coming on, remember that this experience will teach you how to deal with negativity so that you can lead a life full of Positive Vibes.

I’m wishing you more Positive Vibes than you can stand today.

#positivevibes
Image Caption: Wesley Donehue Outside

Title: What Would You Change Today If You Had No Tomorrow?
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes:

How many days do you have left?

The answer is that you have absolutely no idea. We all want to think that we will live into our 80s or 90s. I’m sure that’s the answer my mother, father and step-father would have given.

But my mother died at 48. My father died at 57. My step-father died at 58. 

WOW! This Positive Vibes post is starting off pretty dark, huh?

It’s hard to imagine that in just nine years I will be the age of my mother when she died. And frankly, that scares me a bit. But the one that impacts me the most is my step-father, Robert. His death is the one I think about the most and the one I thought about as soon as I woke up this morning. I’m not exactly sure why but I think it’s because his was the one that could not be avoided while both my mother’s and father’s departures were self-inflicted.

While this has little to do with the point of my post, I feel the need to write about him for a few minutes. Robert and I did not get along when I was a child and through my teenage years. I didn’t appreciate what he did for me and I felt a lot of resentment that my mother remarried. We couldn’t have been more different. He was a blue collar worker and I was a total geek and bookworm. He liked to hunt. I didn’t like getting dirty. He was a man’s man. I wasn’t.

Then I went to college and grew up. I realized how much he did for two kid’s who were not his. He started his own company and became successful and I really admired him. We became drinking buddies. We became actual friends. Then my mother died and we became even closer. One of my favorite memories in my entire life was of him attending Jim DeMint’s US Senate victory party and him telling me how proud he was of me. 

When I proposed to Elizabeth I asked him to be my best man. He went silent and I heard sniffles. I didn’t realize it would mean so much to him. A bit later he called and asked “so what is a father supposed to pay for in all this?” I told him not to worry about it and that I would find a way to pay for the rehearsal dinner. I will never forget that he replied “hell no! I’m paying.” My real father didn’t even attend my wedding.

Robert and I continued to grow closer. A couple short years later he was diagnosed with brain cancer. He passed away in 2008.

Back to my point - I miss Robert dearly and his death completely changed me. Robert did nothing wrong and his time came way too early. I don’t know when my time will come (and I don’t like writing that as my airplane is taking off), but I’ve vowed to myself to make every single day count. I hustle the way I do because I had three parents die young.

If I average just the lifespan of my three parents that’s 54 years old, only 15 years from today. That’s not a lot of time. Tim McGraw sings that we should “live like we are dying.” And that’s exactly what I’m doing.

So here’s my question to you today - how would you change your life if you knew you would die young? 

How would you maximize your days? How would you eliminate negativity and bring more positivity into your life? Would you surround yourself with all the bullshit dominating each of our lives?

Perhaps it’s time to start living a life full of positivity. 

Perhaps you should start today. Because you don’t know how many more days you have left.

I’m wishing you nothing but Positive Vibes to fill your Thursday!

#positivevibes

Title: Write A Plan And Stick To It
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes:

What a Friday! I’m totally bogged down helping a big client and my mind is a bit too cluttered to give you a thoughtful note today. Let me just say this...

We came into 2019 in the worst place we’ve ever been. I was hurting bad and in a total state of depression. I thought the sky was falling. Everything was dark.

I huddled up with my leadership team and developed a plan. We hustled our faces off over the last seven months, followed through on every single point of that plan and just last week I officially labeled the plan COMPLETE AND CLOSED.

Honestly, I think Push is now on the most solid foundation we’ve ever been on. Our staff is back up to it’s highest levels and we have a big roster of clients. We are also totally streamlined, more organized and moving faster than ever before.

All to say, sometimes you have to take a few steps back to make huge leaps forward. So when you get kicked in the gut and you think you’ll be down forever, go into a cave with your allies, write a plan and stick to that plan. Hustle your face off!

Good things will happen and your negativity will turn to positivity. Maybe not immediately. It may take a few months or even a couple years, but Positive Vibes are right around the corner if you STICK TO THE PLAN!

I hope your Friday and your weekend is full of nothing but Positive Vibes!

#positivevibes
Image Caption: Wesley Donehue with Micheal Rentiers

Title: Pray For People
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes:

I cried this morning. I gotta tell you, I’ve become quite the crier since having kids. All kinds of things just hit me right in the heart. Happy things. Sad things. Things I would never expect. Unfortunately today was a very sad thing.

Right before my run I checked Twitter and read the story of Andre and Jordan Anchondo who were killed in the El Paso mass shooting. Jordan died shielding her two-month-old son, who survived and is expected to make a full recovery. Jordan was confirmed dead a few hours later. They leave behind three children - ages 5, 2 and 2 months old. These children are nearly exactly the ages of our three boys. 

I closed my eyes during my run and thought of my in-laws sitting our boys down and telling them that mommy and daddy were now in Heaven. I lost it. These things seem so far away yet they hit so close to home.

It’s hard to write about positivity today because I’m pretty sad. And reading everyone fighting online trying to score political points is making me even more sad. 

Today pray for all the victims of this weekend’s shootings and especially for the Anchondo children. And don’t let any online activist tell you it’s not okay to pray. We need a lot of changes in this nation but before any of that’s done we should pray for the people who are devastated right now.

If you find any positivity in this remember that nothing you’re dealing with right now is even close to what the Anchondo children are dealing with. Your life is pretty damn good! So as I said last week… go live it up because you have no idea when your day is coming.

I hope you can find some positivity in a dark day.

#positivevibes

Title: Stop Pretending Barriers Are Permanent
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes:

Talking about money is always an uncomfortable topic, so hey, let’s talk about money.

I make decent money. I’m not rich, but I do okay. Note I didn’t say “I bring home decent money.” There’s a huge difference. 

I don’t buy fancy suits or expensive cars. I’m the last person you’ll see wearing one of those jewelry type watches or buying boats. Instead I am focused on building Push Digital and my investment portfolio. Most of what I make goes right back into what made me money in the first place - my businesses. My goal is to grow an empire through my holding company.

There’s just one problem with that, which brings me to the whole point of this post - I don’t know anything about finances. I mean absolutely nothing. I’m a smart strategist, a damn good creative and a strong leader. I know how to build businesses and operational structures. But I know jack shit about money. I didn’t go to school for business. I never planned on being an entrepreneur. This all happened through hustle. And straight up y’all, I’m a financial DUMBASS!

So over the past six months I’ve spent the majority of my time at work and any free time I can find improving my financial education. I’ve read two books per week. I read the Wall Street Journal daily. Anytime I get the urge to check social media I check the markets or turn on CNBC instead. I’ve taken five online classes, including real estate investment courses. I’ve signed up for seminars which I will be taking later this year. I’m doing all the things.

I have identified a barrier to my long term goals and I’m working tirelessly to tear down that barrier. Accomplishing my goals is what brings me Positive Vibes but right now I’m feeling a lot of negativity because I do not have the knowledge I need to get it all done. 

I want it bad, but I didn’t even know where to begin. So I just picked a book, then another, and then another until I found a path forward. I’ve wasted time trying to find that path but I feel very comfortable now that I’m heading exactly in the direction I want to head. Today I’m full of Positive Vibes because I’m figuring that shit out.

I hope you’ll forgive the uncomfortable conversation about money and see the ultimate point I’m trying to make - too many of us want to do big things but feel inadequate or even the inability to begin. Screw that! Eliminate the barriers in the way of you reaching your goal and just begin.

Want to lose 20 pounds? Get off the couch and start moving.

Want to take your career to the next level? Get off Facebook and start hustling.

Want to learn how to play the harmonica? Sign up for lessons. Okay, this one is mine and it’s coming!

Reach for those Positive Vibes! Stop pretending that barriers are permanent. Very few are! Don’t let negativity and doubt get the best of you. You got this!

I hope you find all the Positive Vibes you need to crush your goals.

#positivevibes
Image Caption: Wesley Donehue in Meeting

Title: Thank You For Positive Vibes
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes:

I posted today’s story a bit earlier but decided to take it down because I talked about our kids and after the Frothy debacle where pictures of our children were attacked, I thought the post was a bit too transparent. I enjoy writing but I’ve learned the hard way that somehow I’ve become a “public figure” and balancing my natural transparency with real life can be a bit difficult.

I didn’t want to go a day without posting because I have been on a roll for a full month and I don’t want that to end. So for today let me just thank you all for the kind responses to my posts. The texts, emails and DMs have given me more Positive Vibes than you know. I deeply appreciate you all!

I hope you all have had a blessed day full of Positive Vibes.

#positivevibes
Image Caption: Wesley Donehue Postive Vibes Blog

Title: Don't Get Stuck Watching TV
Content:
That picture there... that’s my serious face for when I’m about to get on my soap box and drop truth bombs. Buckle up. It’s about to get rough up in here for today’s Positive Vibes because sometimes you have to hurt people’s feelings to spread real and long lasting postivity. 

Yesterday I put up a snarky little post about Southern Charm. In case you missed it:
_________________________________

When traveling:

Them: where are you from?

Me: Charleston, South Carolina

Them: oh, do you know the Southern Charm crew?

Me: ??‍♂️

Every. Single. Time. ?

_________________________________

I have to tell you... I absolutely hate reality TV. But what I hate even more is when people talk about how their life sucks or how they don’t have what they want or how they can’t do big things AND they watch reality TV. 

Think about it, folks. Instead of living their lives to the fullest people are sitting in front of a TV and watching other people live... people who cause as much drama as they can. These attention whores purposefully spread negativity and then have little girls and douche canoe guys want to be just like them. It’s pitiful. And sad.

This might offend you if you’re one of them, but I’m going to give it to you straight. I think you are less of a person if you are obsessed with reality TV. I don’t mean inherently as in you should be treated like less of a person. I mean that you are less because you could be more. It’s simple math. Five is less than ten and your life resume has five fewer awesome experiences because you are watching other people experience life. You could be improving yourself, your family or your community. You could be making more money to travel to see amazing things. Instead you are just improving the ego and the financial status of the worst of America.

There are a few reality television shows that spread good, but the super majority of them doing nothing but put negativity into your soul. Is that really how you want to live? 

I truly believe with all my heart that America took a turn for the worse when reality TV entered our lives. It changed how we all act and more importantly, how we talk to each other. It normalized drama and negativity.

I have a challenge for you. Turn off of the reality television shows tonight and use that time improving yourself and filling your heart with positivity instead of drama. 

LIVE YOUR LIFE INSTEAD OF WATCHING OTHER PEOPLE LIVE THEIRS!

Add experiences to your life resume. That’s how you find all the Positive Vibes this world has to offer.

Turn off the TV and have a phenomenal day full of Positive Vibes.
Image Caption: Wesley Donehue in Suit

Title: Road to Recovery
Content:
Daily Positive Vibes

Today’s is more of a praise report. Lots of folks have been asking about the condition of my heart post procedure. I’m happy to report that after three weeks of hard training I’ve had no incidents like I was having. 

Today we hit 32 miles on the bike followed by a five mile run in extreme heat and humidity. My heart rate is back to normal. I’m not quite back to my normal speeds and I’m more fatigued than usual. I’m also having occasional flutters. All of that was predicted and expected.

I’m feeling good and on track to be back to my normal self, Jingling all the way.

A quick thank you to MUSC and especially CEO Dr Pat Cawley for sending me to the right man, and that right man cardiologist Dr Michael Field who diagnosed and fixed me up very quickly with amazing support, follow up and overall phenomenal customer service. The folks at MUSC were amazing after months of working with a different team who didn’t seem to care about finding the problem and who even threatened not to help me if I continued doing endurance events.

I’m not 100% yet but I’m definitely back on track to take on my big fall races.

Thank you for all the kind messages!

#positivevibes
Image Caption: Wesley Donehue with Trainer

Title: Force Yourself To Act
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes

This is a picture of me typing out my funeral plans. No, seriously. Here me out...

Yesterday I had the honor of serving as an usher at the funeral for my F3 brother Mark Smith. His F3 name was Wilson, as in the ball from the movie Castaway. It’s because he flew those big cargo jets in the US Air Force.

There’s just something about a military funeral that hits you in the heart harder than civilian funerals. The gun salute, the playing of taps, the folding of the flag and handing it to the family, half the crowd in uniform and saluting and in this case, a fly over from what I think was a C-17 (what do I know?) All of it to remember a really great guy I got to know during F3 bootcamps, a man who cared deeply for his nation and his local community.

While ushering with me, Eddie Crosby (F3 Cousin) asked “have you planned your funeral?” He went on to say that handling the details myself would take a lot of stress off my family and give them the time they need to mourn.

His question and statement hit me like a ton of bricks. At first I thought to myself “I have plenty of time to do that.” Then I thought “well, if I get sick I still have time.” Then I finally thought “well shit, what if there is an accident?”

Last night I couldn't shake Cousin's question so I started jotting down some notes. Yes, I want to save my family stress, but even more so this activity helps me face the inevitable and that makes me think about how short life is and how I want to maximize every day... how I want to build my life resume (tomorrow’s topic).

It all goes back to the post I published last week about my step-father, Robert. You might not live into your eighties or nineties. You may not have thirty or forty years left to “get around to it.” You might go out for a run and get hit by a car tomorrow. Do you really want to waste that time sitting on a couch?

Not me!

I’m accepting that I’m going to die and that date could come sooner than I would like. That might be dark but it’s just like training for an event or studying for a test. That event is coming so I better get up early and train. That test is coming so you better study today. There might not be time to just cram it all in.

In planning my funeral I accept the inevitable which forces me to look at today differently. It forces me to act - to build my relationship with God and to hustle to grow my companies and build wealth so that I can experience all that I can with my family.

These posts aren’t supposed to necessarily spread cheer. It’s a discussion on how we can live more awesome lives full of positivity. I truly believe in this case that facing and accepting the negative builds a life of positivity! That’s my game plan.

I hope you all have a week full of Positive Vibes. I also hope you will take 30 seconds out of your day today to pray for the Smith family. Wilson was a great dude taken way too early from his loving family.

#positivevibes
Image Caption: Wesley Donehue working at Desk

Title: Build Your Life Resume
Content:
Your Daily Positive Vibes:

What exactly is life without positivity-fueled experiences?

God gave us an entire planet to explore with a mind capable of limitless dreams and a resilient body able to explore the unseen and ready to make those dreams come true. Yet most of us sit idly by wasting the greatest gifts given to us by our maker. If that’s not an affront to God, I don’t know what is.

So many of us concentrate on building our work resumes and never even consider what a life resume looks like, worse yet, how to actually build our life resume.

A few questions to answer:

Who are you?

What do you believe in?

What are your strengths?

What are the top moments in your life?

What awesome experiences do you want before you die to live a life full of Positive Vibes?

How do you spend your time?

Answer those questions and you can start building your life resume as it stands today and that will guide you to having an amazing life resume full of Positive Vibes in the future.

Jesse Itzler is one of my favorite “celebrities” because he’s an extremely successful entrepreneur, a dedicated family man and an avid endurance athlete. He’s the public person I most relate to. Ladies, you may know him more as the husband of Sara Blakely, the CEO of Spanx and one of the most successful female entrepreneurs in the country. Anyway, he posted his life resume yesterday along with this template. I urge you to create yours too. I'll post the link in the comments.

Wishing you a Tuesday full of #positivevibes
Image Caption: Blog by Wesley Donehue|Build Your Life Resume by Wesley Donehue
