Title: Is The Social Media Fight Worth It?
Content: “How long are you going to wait before you demand the best for yourself?” ⁃ Epictetus For me the answer was “way too long.” And in many ways I’m still waiting. Every day I find myself wanting to engage in a social media argument. Today’s culture tell us to “speak your truth.” But why? How many times have you been convinced by a social media debate? How many times have you been like “yeah, he’s right, I’m changing my mind?” No one’s mind is changed on Facebook or Twitter. We come to these platforms so that our opinions are reinforced. We want that hit of dopamine that comes from all the likes, shares and “yeah you’re rights.” Ask yourself - what do I have to gain from getting in a social media argument? Then ask yourself - what do I have to lose? Let’s talk about me, my favorite subject, for a minute. I’ve never gained one dollar from a social media fight. On the flip side I was named Worst Person In The World by Keith Olbermann on MSNBC. I’ve made national news multiple times. I almost lost my brewery investment. For what? To prove my point? To put someone in their place? To prove I’m intellectually superior? It’s ego. Plain and simple. Pure stupidity. I’ve gained nothing, embarrassed myself and my team, had people harass my family, lost clients and cost myself a minimum of one million dollars. I almost lost more than that. I write this today because I woke up to a comment on my last post and I wanted to argue. Then I realized that I have absolutely nothing to gain and my limited mental energy is better spent elsewhere. So ask yourself something today - is this comment worth it? Then ask ask yourself what Epictetus asks - how long am I going to wait before I demand the best of myself?

Title: I’m not slowing down. I’m speeding up.
Content: I’m so sick and tired of people telling me to slow down. Family. Friends. Doctors. To hell with that bullshit. I’ll slow down when I’m dead. Mom was dead by 48. Dad was dead by 52. If I average them out I’ll be dead in 9 years. I have money to make and finish lines to cross. I have companies to build and teammates to support. Most importantly I have a future to secure for my family. These three little guys will have the opportunities I didn’t have. These three little guys will see the world. These little guys will see that anything and everything is possible. I won’t be teaching my boys by words alone. I will be teaching them through action. Through example! I’m not slowing down. I’m speeding up. I won’t get stuck in the systems made by the elite to control us all like sheep. I see their traps. They won’t get me. They won’t get my boys either. Find something that motivates you and helps you avoid the traps they’re laying. For me it’s the fact that I could be dead in just nine years. What about you? PS - look, I really do love all my friends telling me to slow down. You know who you are. I know you care. I care about you too. I’m just not listening to you.

Title: The Way of Men Book Review
Content: I’m so behind on book reviews. Work and family life has been nuts lately. Let’s knock this one our real quick? What’s it mean to be a man? That’s the question Jack Donovan answers and it’s one that needs to be answered in today’s America when masculinity is being cancelled by liberals. Donovan explains succinctly why we need strong masculine men to protect our communities and our nation as a whole. This was a really short book that I recommend to all men. #42in2021

Title: #Maxout Your Life Book Review
Content: Maxout your Life by Ed Mylett I said I was done with self help books from online gurus but I broke my rule because I really do like Ed Mylett. I love his videos, podcast and Instagram posts so I decided to order the book he’s always pushing. I shouldn’t have. Despite being nothing more than a glorified pamphlet and only taking two hours to read, it was a total waste of time. There is nothing new in the book that hasn’t been covered by every other self help guru. Don’t get me wrong, it’s all valuable information if you haven’t read other books that are exactly like it. The only difference here is that Mylett cuts through the bullshit and gets straight to the point with his lessons. Crush it, 10x it or Max it. It’s all the same shit. Wake up earlier Work harder than everyone else Find a purpose Live your purpose Meditate Hydrate Exercise Live happily ever after It’s all great information but trust me, there’s a hell of a lot more to it. More money, more problems. More staff, more problems. More competitors, more problems. Hustle isn’t everything. Because frankly, no one outworks me, but many people are richer. #43of2021

Title: Kings of Crypto Book Review
Content: I’m getting a ton of questions about crypto from my friends because I’m putting a percentage of my income into the industry. Today I’m in Boston learning about the blockchain technology behind cypto, referred to as Web3, which will totally change everything about the world as, or even more than, the current iteration of the Internet has. I’ve also been reading some books about crypto, starting with this one about Coinbase, the most popular app to buy and store cryptocurrency. It’s a fast read and it boils it all down to its most simple explanation with fun stories to keep you interested. It’s not a technical book. It’s a good book for beginners with basic questions. If that’s you then I recommend it. #44for2021

Title: Snow Crash Book Review
Content: Snow Crash by Neil Stephenson  You’ve heard of cryptocurrency. You may have heard of NFTs. They are all the rage right now because folks think they are a new form of asset class for investment. Others think they are a new form of digital currency. Real nerds know they are a lot more and it’s all way deeper than some get rich quick investment. They are the first signs of a new Internet, referred to as Web3. Imagine if you could go back to the early days of the Internet. That’s where we are today. The Internet you know now will be irrelevant. A new distributed Internet will emerge based on blockchain technology and away from the big server farms of Google and Amazon. This new Internet will allow you to take your digital assets with you and into a new virtual world that you create. Think about Fortnite, but for every part of your life, and way more encompassing. Have you seen Ready Player One? It’s basically the Oasis. Today it’s called the metaverse, a name taken directly from this science fiction book - Snow Crash by Neil Stephenson. Jeff Bezos once said “the dreamers come first. It’s always the science-fiction guys: They think of everything first, and then the builders come along and they make it happen. But it takes time.” That’s exactly right. Stephenson dreamed of the metaverse in 1992. Nearly thirty years later we see the first signs of it’s creation. It may take a couple more decades to be fully here but it will eventually be here. Stephenson places us a few years in the future after a complete global economic collapse. Many people are living virtual lives in the metaverse when a computer virus appears that can fry the brains of computer hackers while turning normal people into religious cultists. Our main protagonists are trying to save the real world and the metaverse by figuring out where the virus comes from and how to destroy it. Snow Crash is science fiction with a ton of religious dogma weaved within it’s action. I loved it. If you’re a nerd you’ll love it too. #45in2021

Title: Bitcoin Billionaire Book Review
Content: Ben Mezrich wrote the definitive account of Facebook’s founding with Accidental Billionaires, which was the basis of Aaron Sorkin’s The Social Network. I’m sure you’ve seen the movie. Mark Zuckerberg totally screws over the Winklevoss twins. With “I’m 6’5, 220 and there’s two of me,” “the Winklevii” definitely come across as the losers of the story. With Bitcoin Billionaires Mezrich tells the second chapter of the Winklevoss story as early investors in Bitcoin, founders of a crypto exchange company and perhaps the most well known team in crypto circles. The side characters in this story are also totally fascinating. This is not a technical book. It is, however, a real pager turner. I loved it. The story is great. It can give you an introduction to crypto and the story of its earliest adopters. Even if you aren’t interested in crypto it’s a fascinating story of anyone interested in entrepreneurship or investing. #46in2021

Title: Project Hail Mary Book Review
Content: Project Hail Mary by Andy Weir I’m about eight book reviews behind. I will try to knock them out over the next week to give you some recommendations. Did you love The Martian by Andy Weir? If so, stop what you’re doing right now and purchase Project Hail Mary. Wier’s latest book is amazing. I couldn’t put it down and I wanted it to never conclude. Humanity is going to end. An algae has attacked the sun and is consuming it’s energy. An ice age will hit Earth but not before the cold kills most crops, pushes all of humanity into starvation and before any of that can happen, the total collapse of society. A team has been sent to another system where a sun not being destroyed by the algae has been found. They must discover what’s unique about that sun to save ours, our planet and every living being. Go get this book immediately if you love science fiction. I LOVED this one so much. #48 in 2021 Thanks Matt Moore for the fantastic recommendation!

Title: A New Phase
Content: Today begins a new phase in my journey. I have spent the last three days with a mastermind group in Ohio. As I leave this morning I’m more motivated than I’ve ever been. I’ve always considered myself to be a hard worker and a hustler. I haven’t met a lot of men who outwork me. But the guys in this group are operating at a level that I didn’t know existed. What’s even more mind blowing is that some of them aren’t even working that hard. They’re just working smart, much smarter than I am. They aren’t wasting their time on bullshit like political maneuvering and social media antics. They’re goal oriented, focused, determined and printing cash like it’s nothing. Their entire world view is different. I encourage you all to seek out new relationships with people who will blow your mind. Find people operating at a higher level. Find people who will teach and encourage you. If you want to be a killer you have to surround yourself with killers. My life is about to change and the Donehue family is going to the next level. It’s like that.
Image Title: 210811_Wes_Blog Cover_A New Phase|wd-a-new-phase|210811_Wes_Blog Cover_Giving Up Isn't The Answer|210811_Wes_Blog Cover_Next Adventure|210811_Wes_Blog Cover_Relations Issue|210811_Wes_Blog Cover_Starts With Our Children|210811_Wes_Blog Cover_Stop Regretting|210811_Wes_Blog Cover_You're On Your Own

Title: Stop Regretting
Content: This is the biggest single change I’m making in my life - I’m going to stop regretting. No, I’m not going to just stop thinking about things I should have or have not done. I’m going to make sure on the front end that there is nothing to regret. I’m going to stop hesitating. I’m going to stop stopping. I’m going to never let fear get in my way again. I’m sitting here this morning looking at another bounce in the crypto markets. I knew last month that I should have dumped more money in. I don’t just think, I know with 100% certainty that crypto is the future. Still, I let naysayers and fear hold me back. Now I’m sitting here drinking my coffee, watching CNBC and thinking of nothing but regret. That won’t happen again. Five years ago I told Phil, my main man at Push, that we should start a new division of the company. For some reason I told myself it wasn’t the right time although I knew it was. We had a lot of other things moving and I didn’t want to spend the $100k to get it started. Now I look back at how that industry has grown and realize I left at least $5 Million on the table just because I was scared to spend $100k. I have a superpower. I can spot trends before they happen. I see what’s coming down the road. It’s why I saw the emergence of digital in campaigns and marketing and jumped on it early, while making no money for a few years, while all the TV guys called it a fad. I also have a kryptonite. It’s fear. And the fear only grows larger as the family and the company has grown. There’s so much more to lose. I certainly can’t risk my family’s future. But I know that risk is part of the game. Those who succeed are those who punch fear in the face. Those who move. Those who never regret. So I’m done regretting. It’s time to make some moves. Let’s roll. Wishing you so many Positive Vibes today! W.

Title: Giving Up Isn't The Answer
Content:
This morning we hit the road for my first triathlon since December. This one is a short Olympic distance race at Lake Logan, about 30 minutes outside of Asheville, North Carolina. Swim - 1500 meters Bike - 24 miles Run - 10k
I’m super excited to be racing with my friends Jenn, Alex, Chris and Jaime. But I’m even more excited to have my family there. Nothing gets me more excited than seeing my wife and three boys on the side of the road. I’m so eager to show my boys that anything is possible when they create a plan and do the work.
Triathlon has been a real struggle for me. Those of you following my journey over the last few years understand why. I didn’t know how to swim beyond not dying. I hadn’t been on a bike in twenty years and never on a fast road bike. I wanted to learn a new skill and I wanted the boys to see me struggle.
And recently, struggle I have. I tore a quad and haven’t been able to run for a month. Last week I slipped a disk in my back. For the last two days my whoop scores have been abysmal and my body definitely feels as if it’s fighting something off.
Still I go. Not because I even feel like racing. I go to show my boys that giving up isn’t the answer. I especially want to show Harlowe, who like his mother, is a perfectionist. He gets so mad at himself when he messes up during cello practice. He wants to quit because he can’t do it the way he wants to do it. I have to remind him of my first triathlon when I was the last out of the water. I swam to the shore and walked part of the pond. My buddy Dave swam by me and asked if he needed to grab a lifeguard. Yeah, it was that bad. It may have been the most publicly embarrassing moment of my life. But I kept going and I finished. Then with the help of Endurance Farm I built a swim plan and over the last three years I have progressed to being able to finish a 2.5 mile swim.
Look, I still suck. I mean I really really suck. I finish though. And my boys see me cross that finish line and they see me wear that medal for the rest of the day.
These boys are going to learn that sucking is okay, but finishing is mandatory.
Wishing you many positive vibes!
W.

Title: Until The Next Adventure
Content:
Race report. I was really worried going into this race. I trained hard over the summer and up until a month ago I thought I was in the best shape of my life. Then all hell broke loose. I injured my quad and then slipped a disc in my back. Over the past four days I’ve been pretty sick. I woke up race day feeling like crap. Knowing I wouldn’t PR this race I went in with three goals:
  1. Finish. Given my injuries this was the first race I was actually worried about DNFing.
  2. Seek revenge on Lake Logan. I did a half Ironman distance triathlon in this lake three years ago and it was by far my worst swim ever.
  3. Beat the crew I came with. Look, I hate to sound like a jerk but I’m competitive. It’s a good thing. Training partners make each other better by pushing each other.
Pre race: I just put in the EarPods and zoned out trying to not think about how cold the water would be. Swim: I was in the water for 42 mins. I’m so bad. The water wasn’t as cold as I remembered. While I was slow, mentally I was in a great place. Breathing was also spot on. The back became an issue when I popped up to site. I swam half the race in a lot of discomfort. About 200 meters from the end we swam up a river which was about 10 degrees colder. It must have been the cold because when I exited the water onto the dock, both legs completely cramped and I hit the dock hard where I had to lay for a few seconds. They eased up and I sprinted to transition. T1: I had trouble getting my wetsuit off but besides that I stormed out. I don’t believe in sitting in transition. Recover on the bike. Bike: My best ride ever. I’m shocked. The climbs were brutal and I about pooped my pants on some of the declines. I came out of the water so far behind my crew and knew that I had to close the gap on the bike. I just put my head down and did the work in hopes that I wouldn’t crush my injured quad too hard before the run, where I excel. T2: In and out faster than a man’s first time with a woman. Run: It’s on. I nailed a 6:30 for my first mile. I saw Jaime and then immediately saw Jenn. I was stoked. Then I saw Chris. I had caught them all. Just one problem. The girls went in the water four mins after me so even though I passed them they were still four mins ahead of me. My quad and my back were on fire. I was in a good bit of pain but couldn’t let up. I had to gain four mins on the girls. I came to the turnaround point and saw one of the girls again way sooner than I thought. She was crushing her run. Shit!! So I just did what had to be done and worked through the pain. Finish: I saw all the kids and choked up as soon as I saw Harlowe. Yeah, I’m a crier during races. The kids all ran to the finish with me. 2:56:46. It wasn’t a great performance but I met all my goals. I ended up beating my crew by just 90 seconds. Summary: I have a lot of work to do in the water. I need to rest my body and fix these injuries before going too hard into my full Ironman training for the Cozumel race Nov 21. Two weeks from now I pace my mentor, Terry, as he crushes the Leadville 100 in Colorado. Luckily I only have to run 35 miles. “We’re done with the mission. Octonauts at ease, until the next adventure.”

Title: You're On Your Own
Content: Masks work. Masks don’t work. Certain masks work. Masks work if you wear two of them. Vaccinate or mask up. Vaccinate and mask up. Vaccines work. Vaccines don’t work. Vaccines work but you need a booster. You don’t need a vaccine if you have natural immunity. Natural immunity isn’t enough. I could go on and on. Trust doctors. Even if different doctors say different things. Trust science. Even though the science keeps changing. The only fact at this point is that facts change and we don’t know who to trust. That leaves only one person you can trust - yourself. You hear people, including me, say “don’t be a sheep.” I’m not trying to insult anyone. I’m using the word sheep to simply and pointedly describe specific people - those who just do what they’re told without thinking for themselves. They simply follow. For most Americans, being a sheep is just fine. If you just follow the herd you will typically end up okay. You won’t crush life, but you’ll survive. The problem is that right now you don’t have the luxury of simply following the herd. The herd is scattered because there is no specific shepherd. The herd has no clear direction and there is a good chance the herd walks right off a cliff. This leaves you no choice but to start thinking for yourself and taking clear action to protect your family. At some point you have to wake up and realize that no one is going to protect you. Not the federal government or state government or some medical entity. You’re on your own. You have to do it all yourself. You also have to realize that others need to do what’s best for themselves. Get out of their business. It’s not your business why they mask up or get vaccinated, and visa versa. Their medical decision is NONE OF YOUR DAMN BUSINESS! No one knows anything about this virus or what is going to happen. That’s obvious and if don’t see it then you have your head buried in the sand. It’s not going away anytime soon. There is no “new normal” because normal means consistency. So you don’t have a choice. You have to start thinking for yourself. You have to start doing what’s best for your family. You have to realize that things aren’t going back to the way they used to be. You’re on your own. Stop waiting for someone to give you permission to live. Stop accepting government telling you how to live. Stop being a sheep.

Title: COVID 19 Vaccine: Medical Issue or Public Relations Issue?
Content:
The vaccination issue is not a medical issue at all. It’s a public relations issue. It is, quite simply, an issue of trust. As much as Democrats are trying to blame Republicans, the distrust in government actually goes both ways. Prior to the election Joe Biden, Kamala Harris and Andrew Cuomo all stated that they would be hesitant to take any vaccine “rushed” by the Trump administration, the same vaccines being pushed today. It was these leading Democrats who first threw a shadow of distrust on the process. Governor Cuomo went so far as to urge New York residents not to take the vaccine at all. Now Cuomo is urging businesses to move toward “vaccine only admission” while wondering why there is so much vaccine hesitation. All the while African Americans, the base of the Democratic Party, remains more than 50% unvaccinated across the nation. Some claim the stat is a result of access, while others put the blame solely on issues of trust. James Hildeth, a member of Biden’s Covid-19 task force, told Politico “we still have some places where the past history of bias, discrimination and hate has just caused such an ingrained mistrust of political and social structures that it’s hard to break through that.” Turning to Republicans, it’s pretty obvious that a party already ideologically opposed to government action, would naturally be hesitant to anything government is pushing. Add on that it’s currently being pushed by a liberal administration, it’s easy to forget that the push was started at “warp speed” by none other than President Donald Trump. Given the popularity of President Trump we see just how much Republicans distrust government institutions and the politicians, of both parties, pushing, well pretty much anything. Now turn to the pharmaceutical companies where my personal mistrust lies. 841,000 Americans have died from a drug overdose since 1999. 70% of those, or roughly 588,000, have died of an opioid overdose. One of them was my mother who overdosed on fentanyl. Despite this nightmare, the companies that produced these drugs, pushed them on victims and lied to the world, their leaders remain unscathed, out of prison, and still in power. This is the same industry and some of the same companies creating vaccinations and telling us they are safe. Put yourself in my shoes or anyone who lost a relative to an opioid overdose. Is it really so hard to understand why we would distrust these companies? Now turn it around. Put yourself in the shoes of an older American, someone with an underlying health condition or someone who lost a relative to Covid-19. It is really so hard to understand why they would push vaccinations? I write to point out that we have a much bigger problem than the current vaccination fight. Americans no longer trust America. We don’t trust our institutions. We don’t trust our leaders. We don’t trust each other. I don’t know how to fix the trust issue but here are a few places to start:
  1. Politicians should stop being lying dirtbags and think about something other than destroying the other party. Realize that you can’t have it one way when you’re trying to win an election and another way once you win. Your words have repercussions.
  2. Criminally punish killers, like the leaders who pushed opioids on America.
  3. Have empathy for one another. Put yourself in your neighbor’s shoes for a few minutes.
  4. Lastly, think on the primary lesson given to us by Jesus Christ and love your neighbor as yourself.
I pray that Americans will one day trust America again. If not, we are already on the path to our great nation’s destruction. It won’t come at the hands of an enemy. The hands of destruction will be our own.

Title: Producing Healthy Americans Starts With Our Children
Content: I’m a sickly person. Friends will tell you that I’m always sick. If it’s cold season I’m getting it bad. If it’s flu season I’m going down hard. The truth is that I have a weak immune system and I know exactly why. I can live an extraordinary healthy life, and I try to, but I don’t think I’ll ever truly overcome my beginnings. I tell you this because it’s one of the biggest problems facing America. This COVID debate is driving me crazy. Mask vs anti-mask. Vaxx vs anti-vaxx. Republicans vs Democrats. Everyone vs everyone. Still a year and a half later no one is talking about how to produce healthy Americans who can fight off disease. I’m no doctor but I know for 100% certainty that it starts with our children. I was a welfare child and looking back, I don’t remember eating anything that wasn’t processed shit. I remember eating sugar filled cereal for breakfast, lunch and dinner. I don’t ever remember eating fresh veggies or fruits. We never ate clean meat. Most meals were microwaveable TV dinners that can barely even be classified as food. Even our toothpaste was full of sugar. As a result I’m having to spend years correcting what my mother did to me. That sounds harsh but truth be told, I don’t think she knew any better and if she did she couldn’t afford anything different. She was doing everything she could to make sure we weren’t homeless and had anything to eat at all. Too many Americans face the same predicament. They don’t understand health because America pushes drugs and shots instead. They can’t afford real food. Many live in food deserts. Still, too many can afford better but they’ve become Americanized into believing that drugs, shots and processed shit is okay. Being fat and sick is normal. All the while their children are always sick. Refuse to go along with the American way of life. Cheap isn’t better. Easy isn’t better. Normal is absolutely not better. Go get your vaccine. I really don’t care. But for the love of God give your children a better foundation than the one I got. We live in a day when you have access to the knowledge. Be different. Your children deserve it. Anyway, here’s a cute picture of Tennyson from this weekend.

Title: The Art of Happiness Book Review
Content:
The Art of Happiness by George K. Strodach

Eat, drink, screw and be happy. Most people think Epicureanism is all about hedonism. It’s all about speaking pleasure. I mean after all, Epicurus did create the first hippy communes where people screwed all day. This translation of Epicureanism is only partly true. Epicurus did push pleasure above all else, but pleasure in the long term sense. Eating and drinking all day will make you fat and being fat can lead to long term pain. So does fathering a bunch of children or catching diseases. So yeah, all that stuff can be pleasurable in the moment but it can lead to mental anguish and less freedom, two things that Epicurus put above all else in the search for pleasure. More than anything, Epicurus believed that pleasure can only be found when we rid ourselves of the anxiety of death, the most common of all anxieties. I enjoyed this book in my continued journey through philosophy. There are definitely some good items here that I can adopt in my life, but not nearly as many as I find in stoicism. This is definitely a must read for anyone interested in philosophy. But unlike the writings of Seneca or Epictetus, I don’t see a lot of useful information that I would recommend to most people. #49in2021

Title: Surprised by Joy Book Review
Content:
Surprised by Joy: The Shape of My Early Life by CS Lewis 

A very short book review. CS Lewis is my favorite author and his Christian apologetic works Mere Christianity, Screwtape Letters, The Great Divorce and many more are some of my all time favorite books. Most interesting about Lewis, and why he’s such an amazing apologist, is that he was an atheist. As a former nonbeliever he is able to craft logical defenses that appeal to me rather than the emotional angles taken by many authors. If you enjoy Lewis you will enjoy this memoir about his life from birth to his acceptance of Christ. If you aren’t a Lewis fan you will find this book rather dull and unimportant. But how could you not be a CS Lewis fan? #50in2021

Title: Stop Caring What People Think
Content: Let me be clear - I no longer care what you think of me. So many of us hold back because we care what everyone around us thinks. We fear embarrassment. We fear being disliked. We fear being outcasts in our community. I’m done playing the game. I don’t want my boys seeing me being part of this petty bullshit because I don’t want them to be a part of it either. Let me ask you a few questions. What did you do to be an American? What did you do to get these liberties? What did you do to get these rights? The answer is nothing. You did nothing to be an American. You were lucky. Your parents hooked up here and you just happen to be born in America by some miracle. That could’ve happened anywhere. That sperm and egg could have connected in North Korea or China or Afghanistan. And you are wasting it all. A fish doesn’t realize it’s in water. Similarly we are so used to our freedoms that don’t even realize how lucky we are. It’s amazing how out of touch we are in our comfortable little American bubbles. While people in Afghanistan are falling from airplanes because they are so desperate to leave their nation, our biggest concern is what other people think about us. Or where we are going to drink tonight. Or our delicate little feelings. Imagine what those Afghanis would do for the opportunities we are wasting caring what other people think. It’s silly. And it’s small. People are risking their lives for what we have and our biggest problem is that we have too much, enabling us to sit our fat asses on the couch, over consuming and getting fatter. We are so scared to get off the couch and act boldly because our neighbors may talk shit behind our backs. “What are they doing? Can you believe that? Who do think they are?” What are we doing with the pure luck we stumbled upon? Nothing. Absolutely nothing. Two weeks ago I told you that I’m done with regret. The next step is to stop caring what other people think. These are two of many lessons my boys will learn as I figure out how to overcome our nation’s slide toward mediocrity.
Image Title: 210819_Wesley Donehue_Stop Caring What People Think Blog_01|wd-stop-caring-what-people-think

Title: Ready Player Two Book Review
Content:
Ready Player Two: A Novel by Earnest Cline 

Just today Facebook released it’s new virtual workspace product, Horizon Workrooms. They write “workrooms is our flagship collaboration experience that lets people come together to work in the same virtual room, regardless of physical distance.” This is one of the first steps we will see toward a metaverse, popularized in books I have already reviewed, Snow Crash and Ready Player One, where we will live our daily lives in a computerized world. We already see many people spending time in virtual gaming worlds, such as Mindcraft, but most of these game are not yet totally immersive. Soon they will be and we will also be working, drinking with friends and even racing in virtual worlds. Hell, I’m already close to it myself. My triathlon bike is connected to a computer where I race people around the world on a virtual course. The front of the bike is connected to a device that lifts and lowers the bike when I hit inclines and declines. The back tire is connected to a device that creates tension. A fan sits in front of the bike that blows at a rate corresponding with my speed. All I need is a virtual headset and I expect that technology to be here in the next five years. It sounds fun, but what happens next? Where does all this virtual living lead? If we can create virtual worlds, can we replicate real people to live in those worlds? Can we scan a person’s brain and upload it to the virtual world when that person dies, thus overcoming death itself? These are the questions tackled in the sequel to Ready Player One, appropriately titled Ready Player Two. I enjoyed this book but nowhere near as much as I enjoyed Ready Player One. It wasn’t as tech and sci-fi nerdy as the first, instead leaning more into 80s pop culture. If you’re a fan of John Hughes movies or Prince, you will probably like this book more than I did. Still, the plot it sound and it’s a good sequel. It’s just no Empire Strikes Back. If you took the time to read Ready Player One, which you definitely should, then you should also read this book if for no other reason than to find out what happens to the characters. It’s also a good lesson to where the metaverse could take us. #51in2021

Title: A Supportive Partner is Imperative to Your Success
Content: There are so many self help books and online experts giving advice as to how you can take your life to the next level. Nearly all of them skip over the most important piece of advice, the actual foundation for all the other advice. If you don’t get this one thing right you will absolutely fail at everything you try to do. You will fail at starting a business, building new streams of income, getting fit, crossing finish lines and pretty much everything else. This is imperative - You must have a supportive partner. All of this is a team sport. Any person trying to do big things must have support and not just at the office or on a race course. Physical, emotional and spiritual support starts at home. If that support isn’t there the whole plan crumbles under the weight of time and stress. I’ve seen it. One person has big plans. The spouse is totally not on board. Not only does the plan fail but typically the marriage does too. Today I’m in Colorado to crew and pace my political mentor as he crushes the Leadville 100, one of America’s hardest ultramarathons. Elizabeth is back home with the boys and holding down the fort alone. That’s not easy over four days. Someone take her some booze. She prefers champagne. Really, this is nothing compared to the daily support I get when I’m back home. She helps me train for three hours a day and work around the clock. She’s there for me when I’m injured or sick or having a really tough work day when I just need someone to cry to. She tells me when an idea is stupid or when I need to change direction. She lets me know that an employee isn’t a good fit and when my focus is off. She encourages me when I’m on the right track. She’s always there to cheer me on during a race or to give me a hug when I’m completely drained. She’s the person who tells me to just stop moving and get in the bed. She even reads the Wall Street Journal and sends me clips every morning. 😀 Every accomplishment is also Elizabeth’s. And that’s how it should be in marriage. So if you want to join that new fitness program and lose weight, you better get your spouse on board. Want to create a business, invest in crypto or buy a rental property? You better get your spouse on board. Want to take your life to the next level? Get your spouse on board. It’s the foundation of every plan.

Title: Die With Zero Book Review
Content:
Die with Zero: Getting All You Can from Your Money and Your Life By Bill Perkins

Ugh! Still about six book reviews behind. I’ve been just so slammed up recently that I have had little time to write. Let me knock this one out real quick because it was quite mind shifting for me. It’s probably because I grew up poor, but since I started making income beyond my daily living I mostly store it away like a little squirrel storing away his nuts for the winter. My focus has been on building a nice little nest egg for retirement. Then I started building my personal wealth and my focus shifted to building generational wealth for my children. This book makes a counter argument. We should be spending more money while we are younger because we will have more flexibility and energy to have fun. The goal of life should be to grow memories and experiences. When you are on your death bed all you have left are memories. Cash means absolutely nothing. I like that, a lot. Additionally, why save up money for your children when they are most likely going to be older and comfortable by the time you die? Your children may want the money, but they aren’t as likely to actually need the money when they are say, 50 years old. They actually need the money when they are younger. When they are trying to buy a home or start a business. Cash is a means to an end. It’s not the end itself. I strongly recommend this book. It has me thinking in a completely different way. #52 in 2021 Thanks for the recommendation Brian Sigmon

Title: Eisenhower in War and Peace Book Review
Content:
Eisenhower in War and Peace by Jean Edward Smith

Today seems like a great time to post this book review as we stare at the results of electing a weak President. Last week I tweeted “Joe Biden is the epitome of weakness.” Someone replied “who is the epitome of strength?” I think they were baiting me into answering “Donald Trump.” Instead I replied “Dwight D Eisenhower.” Many Presidents exuded strength. Washington, Lincoln, Grant, Reagan and yes, Trump. Washington is obviously in a league of his own. Grant was a strong general, but he pretty much bungled being President. Eisenhower was both an amazing strategic military leader and a strong President. The book is broken into two parts. The first tells the story of Eisenhower’s climb up through the military during wartime, culminating with his time as Supreme Commander of the Allied Expeditionary Force in Europe during WW2. As a huge fan of WW2 history, this part of the book was very exciting for me. During his transition time, which I didn’t know a lot about, Eisenhower served as President of Columbia University and then as the first Supreme Commander of NATO. The book then transitions into his second part, the two terms of Eisenhower’s presidency. His focus on civil rights and American infrastructure as well as the establishment of NASA and a number of international incidents were all things I knew. What I didn’t know and found incredibly interesting was his very rocky relationship with Richard Nixon. If you want to know what the complete opposite of weak Joe Biden looks like, read this book and learn about strong Dwight D Eisenhower. I love reading WW2 history and presidential bios so this book was tailor made for me. I definitely recommend. #53 in 2021
Image Title: 210903_Wesley Donehue_Eisenhower in War and Peace Review_01|wd-in-war-and-peace|210903_Wesley Donehue_How To Make Sh_t Happen Review_01

Title: How To Make Sh*t Happen Book Review
Content:
How to Make Sh*t Happen: Make More Money, Get in Better Shape, Create Epic Relationships and Control by Sean Whalen

There’s nothing new in this book other than a unique life story. Most of it is common sense advice you can find in other self improvement books. The difference is two-fold:
  1. Whalen doesn’t waste your time. There’s no fluff. He’s straight to the point. Other authors write page after page of bullshit in some obvious attempt to just make their book longer. It’s infuriating. This is a quick outline that you can consume in one day. And you should.
  2. His tone is amazing. Whalen is a no bullshit guy and he doesn’t sugarcoat anything. If you like my tone, you’ll love his tone.
If you’re going to read just one self improvement book this one is a great one to pick up. You can knock it out rapidly for a quick jolt of motivation. Side note: follow Sean Whalen and his Lions Not Sheep movement on Insta. I want to meet this guy soon. He’s saying what I’ve been saying for years. He’s just better at it because he doesn’t have to worry about losing clients. 😉 #54 in 2021
Image Title: 210903_Wesley Donehue_How To Make Sh_t Happen Review_01|wd-how-to-make-sht-happen

Title: Hero of Two Worlds Book Review
Content:
Hero of Two Worlds: The Marquis de Lafayette in the Age of Revolution by Mike Duncan 

“I'm takin' this horse by the reins making' Redcoats redder with bloodstains.” I have been eager to read a biography of the Marquis de La Fayette since watching Hamilton. This book came out just a couple weeks ago and I was quick to snag it up and knock it out. They call Lafayette “The Hero of Two Worlds” for fighting for liberty in both America and France. I knew a great deal about his heroic acts during the American Revolution and a bit about how he got here. However, I knew very little about his life after going back to France and his actions to establish liberty there. I also didn't know about his time in prison. Admittedly, I know very little about French history at all. And what little I do know comes from my love of Les Miserables and some reading on the battles and rein of Napoleon Bonaparte. Perhaps once I knock out my goal of reading a biography of every US President I will turn some attention to European history. Really, French history makes American history look rather calm and dull. Those folks seemed to have had a revolution every five years for a bit there. I was pretty surprised to read that Lafayette had the opportunity to basically become a dictator in France, had he wished. I knew that he did return to the United States during the presidency of James Monroe but I did not know he visited all 24 states. America’s favorite fighting Frenchmen certainly lived an interesting life. All fans of history should pick up this book. #55 in 2021

Title: Magician vs Mule Book Review
Content:
Magician vs. Mule: The Ultimate Guide to Lifestyle, Wealth, and Freedom by Mark Evans DM 

I said I was done with self help books but I have at least two more for you. This one is a must read for folks wanting to take their lives to the next level, and then the level after that. Mark Evans Dm, the Deal Maker, is my new mentor. I have recently joined his mastermind group and it’s already starting to change my life after just a couple months. Yes, there are many actionable items I am learning but the biggest takeaway is simply surrounding myself with new people who are doing much bigger things than I am. It’s truly inspiring and my brain has been on fire since meeting these men last month. I learned something valuable in my first day with these men and it’s the ultimate lesson of this book. I learned that I do not have a business. I have a job. As Mark would say, I’m a mule. I’m working too hard day in and day out and not seeing my big dreams come true. Sure, things are going great. I have a lot of money in the bank, I’m growing my assets, I love my house and my car and I’m able to put my kids in private school. Still, I’m working my ass off and not getting to the next level. It would be like running an extra twenty miles every week but not picking up any time in a marathon. In fact, I could actually lose time by working so hard, yet so dumb. So how do you get out of that rut and go from being a mule to making magic happen as a magician? This book gives you actionable steps to follow without all the bullshit fluff found in most books of this genre. I definitely recommend it to all of you finding yourself in my situation. #56in2021

Title: Blue Ocean Shift Book Review
Content:
Blue Ocean Shift: Beyond Competing - Proven Steps to Inspire Confidence and Seize New Growth by W Chan Kim 

Ehhh… it was okay. Not every sequel can be Godfather II, Empire Strikes Back or Wrath of Khan. This was more Temple of Doom. Sure, eating monkey brains is cool and all but it’s not Raiders of the Lost Ark. Shit, this is a book and not a movie. Sorry. Blue Ocean Strategy is one of my favorite business books and it’s been a real game changer for my business. I held high expectations for the sequel but it was underwhelming. Where the first focused on larger concepts, the sequel focused on the nitty gritty, the steps on how to reach those blue oceans. Many of you will need those steps so you may actually find this book more useful than the first. I just found myself bored because I have already made some big changes so this is a little late for me. I’m not saying it’s not a good book. I found some things very useful. It just didn’t blow my socks off like the first. So yeah, read it. But don’t expect a giant boulder to roll you over. That makes no sense. You know what I mean. #57in2021

Title: MeConomy Book Review
Content:
MEconomy: How to Control Every Part of Your Life by Mark Evans DM

It’s raining all day in Charleston today. I don’t feel like sitting on I-26 for two hours each way because people can’t drive in the rain. Instead I’m going to work from my couch. I could even sleep all day, although you know that’s not in my DNA. No one tells me where I have to be and when. No boss is telling me to get into the office or counting my sick days. My company is nearly to the point that it can run without me. I’ve spent 12 years building an operation to fund the lifestyle of my choosing. Money. Power. Fame. So many people are chasing that bullshit as if they’re the end. That shit isn’t the end. They’re means to an end. The end is freedom. Complete and total freedom. That’s my takeaway from, MEconomy, the most recent book by Mark Evans Dm. The subtitle is “how to control every part of your life” and that starts by taking control of yourself. Taking control of your time, your mind, your body, your finances, your family… your world. That’s how you get freedom. Mark gives you a no bullshit, no fluff, straight to the point guide on how he designed his life for ultimate freedom and how you can too. I recommend this book for everyone but especially those who are lost or just need a quick kick in the ass. You can knock it out in just one day so that by tomorrow you’re on your way to a new life. #58in2021

Title: Dopamine Nation Book Review
Content:
Dopamine Nation: Finding Balance in the Age of Indulgence by Dr. Anna Lembke

Most of us are addicts and we don’t even realize it. Maybe we aren’t addicted to booze, drugs or sex so we think it’s no big deal. But the truth is too many of us are cell phone, TV, social media and news addicts. We are addicted to the dopamine hit we get every time we get a thumbs up or a news anchor validates our beliefs. I know it’s true because it’s what I do. I was at the forefront of political social media and I’ve seen how these companies have changed their platforms, and how cable news has changed, with the specific purpose of getting you addicted. The name of the game is attention and they, we, have figured out how to feed that addiction. Unfortunately it goes so much deeper. Walk around downtown Charleston and you’ll see the college students with what I call “Adderall eyes.” The nation is finally cracking down on opioids but no one cares that the majority of Americans are walking around completely dependent on some sort of chemical. We need drugs to get up. We need drugs to get down. We need drugs just to interact with people. We tell parents that their kids have ADHD so that drug companies can get humans addicted as soon as they start kindergarten. We are a nation completely dependent on whatever it takes to avoid the real world, be happy all the time and completely avoid pain. That’s what this book is about and it’s a real wake up call. Every single person will read this and realize they have to change something about their life. You need to pick this one up now. I can’t finish this review without pointing out one thing I found odd. The author admits her own addiction. She was addicted to erotic novels. She says she broke the addiction. But then she uses the story of one man, a sex addict, as the foundational story of the book. This man is so addicted to masterbating that he used a record player to build his own masterbation device. Then it went further and he started hooking up electrical wires to his balls. So basically, the author in breaking her erotic addiction, wrote her own erotic novel. Anyway, pick up this book. This nation is heading down a dark dark path and it won’t change until everyone realizes what’s happening. I, for one, am scared. #59in2021

Title: Dave Chappelle is Under Fire Again
Content: Dave Chappelle is under fire again for his jokes about the LGTBQ+ community in his new Netflix special “The Closer.” Rather then evaluating Chappelle’s response to the continued criticism, which was the entire point of the special, it’s more appropriate to critique Netflix who has been attacked by GLAAD and criticized by its own employees. Netflix CEO Ted Sarandos sent an internal memo to staff stating “Chappelle is one of the most popular stand-up comedians today, and we have a long standing deal with him. His last special “Sticks & Stones,” also controversial, is our most watched, stickiest and most award winning stand-up special to date.” In other words, he’s too popular to cancel and he rakes in cash for Netflix, even when he’s most controversial . From a strictly financial viewpoint, Netflix gains a lot and loses very little by aligning itself with Chappelle. Sarandos continued “As with our other talent, we work hard to support their creative freedom — even though this means there will always be content on Netflix some people believe is harmful.” That’s a strong line. Comedy is a big part of Netflix’s strategy and many, if not most, of the specials are full of offensive commentary. To delete Chappelle, the GOAT, is to delete them all and a large portion of Netflix’s appeal. He added “Several of you have also asked where we draw the line on hate. We don’t allow titles Netflix that are designed to incite hate or violence, and we don’t believe ‘The Closer’ crosses that line.” This is a reassuring statement to staff letting them know that content is reviewed and analyzed before simply positing. Netflix bosses understand that in Chappelle’s style of comedy each joke is just one step in the path to a greater lesson, in this case one about empathy. The professional critics are hating on “The Closer” giving it a rating of 33% on Rotten tomatoes. One Forbes headline reads “Dave Chappelle’s ‘The Closer’ Paints A Sad Portrait Of A Declining Comedian.” This is proof positive that mainstream media critics are out of touch with every day Americans as the public has given the special a rating of 97% on Rotten Tomatoes. It’s also proof that the public is more aligned with Netflix than they are it’s critics. I’m not here to argue the morality of Netflix’s decision or the appropriateness of Chappelle’s jokes. Our podcast and my upcoming book is about the controversy and the response. In that vein Netflix’s response to the Chappelle controversy is strong which means they were obviously prepared for the backlash. How could they not be? They knew exactly what Chappelle was saying before they posted the video. They knew where the attacks would come from. They knew how to respond. This is a textbook example of being prepared for the fight. I hope you will take the time to subscribe to our awesome podcast that covers cancel culture and the week’s public relations controversies. - https://open.spotify.com/show/1LDm6cKCTXbOh8ODAZ0zDg….

Title: Everything you put in an electronic format can and will be used against you in the future
Content: As I’m sitting here working on my book a news alert just popped on my phone stating “Raiders Coach Resigns After Homophobic and Misogynistic Emails.” The quick summary is that old emails, some as old as ten years, were uncovered in which coach John Gruden, according to USA Today, “used a homophobic slur to describe NFL commissioner Roger Goodell, denigrated one team's decision to draft a gay player, mocked transgender woman Caitlyn Jenner, deprecated female referees and suggested that a player who kneeled during the national anthem should be fired.” Given that these emails were sent years ago while Gruden worked for ESPN and before he worked for the NFL, there are a couple crisis communications lessons from my upcoming book worth noting. First, a simple piece of advice that I give students every time I’m asked to speak to a class. Everything you put in an electronic format, like email or social posts, can and will be used against you in the future. It’s best to keep the offensive stuff in your head. For stuff that could be taken the wrong way, pick up the phone. When drinking, don’t post or send anything. Second, always do research on a potential leader in your organization. You probably know that in political campaigns we do a lot of opposition research. All those negative ads you see on TV start out as notes in a large binder of documents compiled by a researcher. Everything, and I do mean EVERYTHING, about a person is in these binder. What you probably don’t know is that we do the same for our candidates too. Going into a campaign we have to know as much, even more, about our guy as the other guy. We must know all the threats. And we must know how hard those threats hit. Only then can we be prepared. Corporations must do the exact same. The Raiders organization should have been prepared for the onslaught of bad press they’ve received in the last two weeks. They weren’t and as a result they look foolish and Gruden’s professional life is ruined forever. I hope you will take the time to subscribe to our awesome podcast that covers cancel culture and the week’s public relations disasters. - https://open.spotify.com/show/1LDm6cKCTXbOh8ODAZ0zDg….

Title: Live free and Let Die Book Review
Content: Live and Let Die - Ian Fleming It’s a busy day so I’ll have to drop a short review of Ian Fleming’s second James Bond book “Live and Let Die.” First off, a warning. This book was written in a different time and would definitely be considered racist today. Bond spends most of the book in either Harlem or Jamaica and the supporting characters are nearly all black. The descriptions of these characters are pretty offensive and that’s coming from me who writes daily on how overly sensitive our culture has become. This is different, like way different, like comparing black people to apes different. It’s cringeworthy as hell. If you can get past the word “negro” on every page, this is a fun spy novel. I enjoyed it as much as I did Casino Royale. It’s also important to note that the book is completely different than the movie starring Roger Moore. While the characters are the same, the plot is incredibly different. Live and Let Die is a quick read and if you’re a Bond fan you should read it. I enjoyed it enough to continue my journey through Fleming’s novels. I just don’t know if I will stay in order because Moonraker is next and it’s a really shitty movie. Sci Fi and James Bond don’t mix. But I’m intrigued because the book was written in the 50s and we didn’t even step foot on the moon until 1969. So maybe I do move on to Moonraker next just to see how this is done. We shall see.

Title: Don't focus on getting rich. Focus on living rich.
Content:
I’ve read 152 books in the last twenty-one months. Some I put down and have never thought of again. Some changed my daily habits. A few fundamentally blew my mind and changed my life. One of the latter was Die With Zero by Bill Perkins and I haven’t been able to get his words out of my mind in the last month.
The premise is simple - don’t focus on getting rich. Focus on living rich. Don’t accumulate a lot of wealth that you will never use. Don’t be on your death bed with millions of dollars. Use all the resources at your disposal now to have the most fulfilling life possible.
The immediate question is “what about the kids?” Coming from a background of poverty, creating generational wealth for my kids is very appealing. Perkins argues that we should give our children huge experiences when they are young so that we are shaping their minds in different ways. I’m starting to lean that way. It’s said that “travel is the best education” and “travel is one of few things you can spend money on that makes you richer.” So if you spend money showing your kids the world, they will become better educated humans able to build more fulfilling lives for themselves and others.
Harlowe has been to Paris twice, Tennyson once. Both talk about it every day. It has already fundamentally changed their perspectives on the world because they see how big the world is, something I didn’t see until my twenties.
I’ve already reviewed this book for you once. The fact that I’m going back to it today means you really should pick it up.
I hope your day is full of Positive Vibes.

Title: Casino Royale Book Review
Content: Casino Royale - Ian Fleming Ahead of the release of No Time To Die, Elizabeth and I are rewatching the Daniel Craig 007 movies. This week I realized I’ve never actually read one of Ian Fleming’s books so I decided to pick up the first one, Casino Royale. While many of the details are different than the movie, the main plot points remain the same. I always enjoy the book versions because you are able to get inside the characters’ heads in a way not allowed by a movie. This one was even more fascinating because James Bond is one of my all time favorite characters and the book provides a complete new side to him I had not seen before. Casino Royale is a short fast read that I recommend to all Bond fans. I’m not saying that I’m going to read all the Bond books, but after finishing this book I immediately ordered Live and Let Die.

Title: Runner's High Book Review
Content: Runner's High: How a Movement of Cannabis-Fueled Athletes Is Changing the Science of Sports - Josiah Hesse Do you run? Do you smoke weed? Maybe you should try both at the same time. That’s the simple premise of this book. Hesse dives deep into the use of weed in all athletics but focuses intensely on the running community with an emphasis on ultra running. He provides a well researched analysis of pot culture through history and a political explanation of how weed became a stigma, became illegal and now is becoming legal across the nation. I really enjoyed this book but I must warn all my conservative friends here that Hesse is a huge liberal. He appropriately puts a lot of blame on conservatives for the hypocritical ban on weed, especially when compared to the poison being pumped out by pharmaceutical companies, like the one that killed my mother. However, he has a tendency to go a bit overboard in his obvious disdain for Republicans. I cannot blame him on this particular issue. Still, I really liked this book. I often smelled weed on wooded running trails and even during races. I’ve always wondered what it would be like to get high before a run or race. I have yet to do so because well, I don’t do illegal things. I’m a responsible parent and entrepreneur after all.

Title: How To Get Focused On What Really Matters
Content: My biggest fault as an entrepreneur and a leader is that I get too bogged down in shit I should never touch. I allow myself to get caught up in the emotions of client work and the drama that comes with having a big team. Truth be told, I give too many Fs. That’s been the case over the last three months. It happens a lot in non-election years. The actual work, which I love, slows down. We are forced to hit the road to recruit new clients. We take a step back and reshuffle our priorities, our direction and our team. It means I have to get in the weeds. Except no, I don’t have to. I’ve built a badass team and a company that can mostly run without me. So I don’t have to, but I do anyway and it just exacerbates every issue. We always do better as a company when I personally give less Fs. So that’s what I’m doing. And that’s why I picked up The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F by Mark Manson again, after reading it two years ago, as a reminder. The key isn’t to give no Fs. The key is to become hyper focused on what I do best and what really grows the company and our income. That means giving less Fs about dumb shit and more Fs about a few important things. This book should be called “How To Get Focused On What Matters,” but that isn’t nearly as catchy. If you allow yourself to get all worked up about dumb shit like I do then you need to read this book. It could be a game changer for you if allow yourself to stop giving so many Fs and only give a few Fs about what really matters.

Title: What should Southwest Airlines do?
Content: What should Southwest Airlines do? They are the big public relations loser of the week due to massive cancelations, up to 25%, for five straight days. In a statement released yesterday CEO Van de Ven stated: "The operational disruption began on Friday and was initially created by weather and air traffic constraints that stalled our Florida operations for many hours. As a result, our aircraft and Crews were not in their pre-planned positions to operate our schedule on Saturday. Unfortunately, the out-of-place aircraft and Crew resources created additional cancelations across our point-to-point network that cascaded throughout the weekend and into Monday and Tuesday. Weather and air traffic constraints were not an issue beyond Friday, but it took us several days to re-set our network after the initial challenges.” Ok, that seems like a valid explanation. It’s not one to pacify pissed off passengers sitting in airports, but it seems factual, logical and transparent. Just a few problems: 1. The FAA counters the claim stating there have been no traffic shortages. 2. No other airlines suffered these type issues due to weather. 3. The delays occurred immediately after the pilot’s union asked the courts to block a vaccination mandate by the company. 4. Numerous pilots took to social media claiming they stayed home due to the mandate. 5. The pilots union earlier this week claimed that the issue was not due to vaccine mandates but because of a computer issue they’ve been warning of for years. All to say the airline, FAA, union and individual pilots are all stating different things which makes it look horrible for Southwest. It all plays against a political backdrop dominated by vaccine debates. Conservatives have taken to social media, where my agency focuses, to use Southwest as an example - this is what happens when you take away health decisions from your employees. I’m gonna be honest. This is a very hard one to tackle because there is a whole lot going on here that would take pages to explain and solve. There’s much to be said about the political dynamics but what I find most unique to this situation is how all the different players are saying different things and sniping at each other. I see this happen on a lot of political campaigns. The shit hits the fan and everyone on the team starts playing the blame game. Instead of firing out of the foxhole everyone starts firing at each other for individual survival or to gain some sort of perceived power. The solution is to tackle the issue before it becomes a problem by building a team with a zero tolerance policy for sniping or drama. Everyone must be singing off the same song sheet. That’s much easier in a smaller operation and exceedingly difficult in larger companies, but it can be done. Obviously in this case you can’t necessarily dictate what the FAA says but the company could get the union and the pilots on the same page. Even if they don’t agree on a resolution, they can and should at least be on the same page as to the problem itself. That would provide a foundation for complete transparency rather than what’s happening now where everyone looks shady and like a bunch of liars while customers get more and more pissed off. Customers are going to be pissed for the delays and cancellations but they will be on fire when they’re not getting the honest truth. While the company and the union may be at odds, losing a bunch of customers hurts both. It just doesn’t make sense that they cannot agree on the problem, much less a solution. This story shows a lack of leadership at Southwest. Yes it’s hard to maneuver through the vaccine mandates but that should not cause this kind of messaging disarray. Whether it’s the weather, computer issues or the mandates, everyone at a minimum should be on the same page as to the problem. The fact that they are not highlights a bunch of internal turmoil beyond this specific instance. I hope you will take the time to subscribe to our awesome podcast that covers cancel culture and the week’s public relations controversies. - https://open.spotify.com/show/1LDm6cKCTXbOh8ODAZ0zDg….

Title: Facebook is changing it’s name and why that matters to you
Content:
News broke that Facebook will be changing the name of it’s parent company to better reflect Mark Zuckerberg’s desire to be the creator of the metaverse.

Named after the virtual world of Snowcrash and popularized I’m Ready Player One, the metaverse is the virtual world we will all be living in within the next twenty years.

I’ve been talking about this for years and people called me crazy. Just like the big TV firms called me crazy when I said digital would overtake TV because TV would become digital.

“No, you’re crazy. I won’t be doing that.” Yeah just like you don’t spend hours a day on Facebook or kids don’t live their lives on Minecraft.

Ten years from now you will be spending hours every day, if not the majority of your day, in a virtual world - the metaverse.

You will have a virtual office, home and place to hang out with your friends.

NFTs are an early step. It’s art you will take with you into the metaverse.

And yes, I’ll be pushing political advertising to you, specifically to you the individual, in the metaverse.

Today I’ll spend two hours on a bike inside my home. I’ll ride a virtual course on a computer screen. My back tire is on a trainer that creates tension based on the landscape of the course. The front of the bike is connected to a device that inclines and declines my position based on the grade. A fan sits in front of me that blows based on the speed I’m riding. I’m nearly training for a full Ironman in a virtual world. All I need are goggles that show me my complete surroundings and I will be there. That’s coming in the next few years.

Then it’s the office. Then it’s life.

The future is coming.

And because technology is compounding, it’s all coming faster than you think.

Title: Find Like-Minded Crazies To Push You
Content: Achieving big goals first requires a partner who has your back. Similarly the second biggest requirement is to have a group of people outside of your home who does the same. People who are doing big things, some much bigger than you. People who both push you and teach you how to do bigger and better. People who hold you accountable. People who won’t take your shit and excuses. People who give you total confidentiality, with whom you can be completely vulnerable. For me that comes in two forms. The first is my forum group through the Charleston Harbor Entrepreneur Center. We meet once a month and do a yearly retreat that I’m just now leaving. These people have become like family to me. They have helped me through a lot of highs and a lot of lows,  through celebrations and actual tears. The second is my new mastermind group through Mark Evans DM. These men are absolutely slaying life and showing me that I’ve been thinking way too small. The only way to do bigger things is to surround yourself with like-minded crazies who won’t accept normal bullshit. To surround yourself with average is to be average. The only way to be a killer is to find other killers. Go out and find your tribe. You don’t have to be in this journey alone.
Image Title: 211101_Wesley Donehue_Find Like-Minded Crazies To Push You_1200x628|IMG-9681

Title: A politician isn’t coming to save you
Content:
If we can just get Joe Biden re-elected.

Let’s Go Brandon!

If we can just take back the Senate.

MAGA!

It’s simply amazing to me how many people are waiting for a savior. They sit in front of Fox News or CNN all day obsessed over the power struggle as if their lives will fundamentally change if some politician is elected.

Let me give you guys a wake up call as someone who is deeply entrenched in the political game – NO ONE IS COMING TO SAVE YOU!

Yes, it’s true that some politicians may make it easier for you to succeed. They may lower taxes and reduce regulation. They may make it easier to run a business. But no politician is going to legislate you to prosperity or happiness.

That shits on you!

What the hell are you doing obsessing over all this political bullshit? Why are you waiting? Why aren’t you making moves?

The answer is pretty simple. It’s easier to blame politicians than to blame yourself. It’s easier to yell at the ladies of The View, praise Tucker Carlson or get into a Facebook argument than it is to take ownership of your own life.

We’re given one life to live with limited time. Once a day has passed that day is gone. It’s never coming back. That chance for action is never coming back. That hour watching Fox News is gone.

There’s only one savior and I promise you He doesn’t seek elected office. Until He returns you have to think for yourself, act for yourself and succeed for yourself.

Turn off the TV. Tune out the politics. Take massive action.
Image Title: 211101_Wesley Donehue_A Politician Isn’t Coming To Save You_1200x628

Title: Does Your Partner Have Your Back?
Content: — Real talk —  You won’t accomplish shit if your spouse doesn’t have your back.  And if you don’t have his/her back. Your spouse is your teammate. You have to be crystal clear of the plan and the individual plays. Every accomplishment is an accomplishment for and by each of you. Every dollar made. Every business built. Every finish line crossed. Perhaps one of you will be more out front. That doesn’t mean the other isn’t as or even more important. The other person is most likely the foundation on which the entire life is built. You don’t see the foundation of a structure but it’s the most important part. Marriages fail because the teammates aren’t reading the same playbook. Sometimes they aren’t even playing the same sport. But being on the same page isn’t enough. On every successful team the teammates push each other to be better. And that in turn strengthens the entire team. So it’s not enough that your spouse simply “put up” with what you’re doing. They have to push you to do it. They must completely have your back as your support and your motivation.
Image Title: 211101_Wesley Donehue_Does Your Partner Have Your Back_1200x628|IMG-9682

Title: We are all ignorant about Money
Content: In the last two years I’ve learned how absolutely ignorant I am. In truth, I don’t know how the world works. AND I’M IN POLITICS!! if anyone should understand the world, it’s me. But politics is bullshit. It’s about power. Or really, perceived power. A perceived power that’s always, ALWAYS, fleeting. The powerful committee chair today is a paid lobbyist begging for favors tomorrow. I recently learned that one politician in South Carolina, who was one of the most powerful in our state for decades, now spends much of his days scrubbing urinals. Real power is in the money. The wealthy rule the world. They did before the current politician and they will after. The problem is the most of us don’t understand money. We are completely ignorant. We truly don’t understand global economics, taxes, government spending, banking, the stock market or crypto. We can’t even answer the simple question - what is money? Why? Because our education system is built to keep us in the dark. We are supposed to be sheep. Two years ago I decided to educate myself. I’ve watched hundreds of videos, listened to hundreds of podcasts, read over 150 books and taken multiple courses. Still I haven’t scratched the surface. I’m still ignorant. I write today to encourage you to stop being a sheep controlled by people who want you to stay in the dark. They aren’t going to educate you. Public education is shit. You have to do the work yourself. Don’t take this the wrong way, but you’re ignorant. I know that because I’m ignorant too. We all are. We have been made to be ignorant because knowledge is real power. We become powerful when we learn how the world really works. I’m asked daily about the resources I turn to. I’ll try to compile a list for you soon.
Image Title: 211104_Wesley Donehue_Ignorant About Money_1200x630|211103_Wesley Donehue_People Need To See Failure _1200x628

Title: People need to see failure
Content: At a Halloween party I was asked “are you always that hard on yourself after a race” from a person who read yesterday’s post.  The answer is no. Many times you can’t wipe the smile off my face. I just think it’s important to share my failures because people need to see them.  Let me state that again - PEOPLE NEED TO SEE FAILURE. Social media is incredibly dangerous for our culture and the individual.  Remember, this is what I do all day. I own a digital agency. I am immersed in this. And what I see is incredibly disturbing. The fake lives that people present online shows us that we can never be good enough. We can never be rich enough or pretty enough or in my case fast enough. We can never get those perfect six pack abs. So what happens? We just give up as soon as we hit a rough spot because we believe it’s not meant for us. It comes so easy to everyone else. Instead of actually trying we revert back to our couches in front of a television set. We give up on our dreams and go back to our 9 to 5 jobs. We remain average, scared of taking massive action because we are scared of failure… of being a failure. Those people online are always winning so something must be wrong with me. Friends, every finish line comes with massive failure. Every dollar made comes with staff quitting and clients leaving that breaks my heart and makes me want to ball up in a corner and cry. Still I keep moving. I didn’t even know how to swim five years ago. I embarrassed myself in my first race and walked half the shore after what could only be described as a panic attack. I’ve failed in the water more than I’ve succeeded. Still I put on that wetsuit and swam more than a mile in the open ocean on Saturday.  I’m a massive failure. And that’s how I succeed. Don’t let these fake ass Insta bullshitters convince you that you’re not good enough. You are capable of so much more than you realize. Just get out there and take massive action.
